Bulky Support.description:
Clefairy is an excellent support Pokemon that utilizes its combination of Friend Guard and Follow Me to support frail partners. Sing is used to disable foes, while After You helps fast teams by letting its allies move before common checks like Calyrex-I in Trick Room. Clefairy can also opt for Heal Pulse to keep its team healthy. Tera Grass is preferred to redirect Amoonguss's Spore, but Tera Water can be used instead to resist Overheat from Chi-Yu and Glacial Lance from Calyrex-I. This particular EV spread allows Clefairy to almost always survive Mystic Water Urshifu-R's Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes and cleanly survive Tera Electric Discharge from Choice Specs Miraidon.

A good partner for Clefairy is Calyrex-S, which appreciated After You to deal with Trick Room and Clefairy's defensive options mitigating its frailty, and helping it set up with Nasty Plot. Clefairy is also a good partner for Restricted Pokemon like Terapagos, Zamazenta, and Calyrex-I, with Follow Me and Friend Guard working in tandem with their naturally high bulk. Checks to Clefairy include Taunt users, notably Tornadus and Incineroar, which completely shut it down. It is also extremely passive, needing strong partners to make up for its passivity.

Ninetales-Alola.overview:
• Weather control in Snow Warning and Aurora Veil support give Alolan Ninetales a strong niche in the metagame. Alolan Ninetales's great offensive typing allows it to threaten Chien-Pao, Urshifu-S, and Landorus with an OHKO while also walling the former two.

  • Alolan Ninetales pairs especially well with slower Ice-types that appreciate the added bulk from snow, such as Articuno and Baxcalibur. Hisuian Arcanine also makes for an excellent partner, helping Alolan Ninetales set up Aurora Veil through Intimidate support, dishing out great damage, and threatening Ice-resistant foes, such as Gholdengo, Incineroar, and Kingambit. All of these partners have fantastic offensive pressure through setup or Choice items, making up for Alolan Ninetales's poor offenses. Ogerpon-W does a great job at helping set up Aurora Veil with Follow Me and threatening foes that resist Ice-type moves like Incineroar with Ivy Cudgel.

  • Alolan Ninetales struggles against opposing weather setters such as Tornadus, which can shut down the snow composition. Fire- and Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Chi-Yu are threats, as they resist Ninetales-Alola's and Articuno's Ice-type STAB moves, as well as ignoring Ogerpon-W's Follow Me through Make It Rain and Heat Wave.

Screen Setter.description:
• Moonblast guarantees a 2HKO on Urshifu-R. Helping Hand helps make up for Alolan Ninetales's poor damage output.

  • Light Clay is used to make sure Aurora Veil lasts for the majority of the game.

  • The defensive investment allows Alolan Ninetales to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast and avoid the 2HKO from Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel and Rillaboom's Wood Hammer, while the Speed investment allows it to outspeed Landorus.

  • Tera Fire allows Alolan Ninetales to resist the Fire- and Steel-type moves that otherwise give it trouble, such as Gholdengo's Make it Rain and Ogerpon-H's STAB moves.

Arcanine-Hisui.overview:
• Hisuian Arcanine is a potent offensive Pokemon on many teams thanks to its good Attack, great STAB coverage, and excellent ability in Intimidate, giving it good matchups against Tornadus, Rillaboom, and Chien-Pao.

  • Hisuian Arcanine works best in Tailwind compositions where its average Speed and poor defensive typing don't often hold it back, hence why Tailwind setters like Tornadus make good partners. In return, Hisuian Arcanine can provide Tornadus with Intimidate support, letting it stick around longer and support it with Tailwind or Bleakwind Storm damage.

  • Hisuian Arcanine can be severely overwhelmed by Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Landorus, making Pokemon like Rillaboom and Latias good partners. Hisuian Arcanine also can be hindered heavily from other Intimidate users like Incineroar, meaning it appreciate having Pokemon like Landorus which can threaten it.

Choice Band.description:
• Tera Blast with Tera Fairy can hit foes like Urshifu-R, Urshifu, and Raging Bolt, the former of which walls Hisuian Arcanine's STABs. Head Smash can be used to threaten Pokemon like Incineroar and Ogerpon-W with an OHKO at the cost of being chipped down by recoil.

  • Choice Band boosts Hisuian Arcanine's damage, allowing for OHKOs on top threats like Urshifu-R, Kingambit, and Ogerpon-H.

  • The given EV spread lets Hisuian Arcanine take two unboosted Flutter Mane Shadow Balls and almost always survive a Stomping Tantrum from Ogerpon-H. The Speed EVs let it outspeed Regieleki in Tailwind.

  • Tera Fairy lets Hisuian Arcanine remove its weakness to Fighting-type attacks, which can be useful in a pinch against Chien-Pao; this can also let it survive Surging Strikes from Mystic Water Urshifu-R. Tera Normal boosts Extreme Speed's damage, which can be helpful against neutral targets like Urshifu-R.

Articuno.overview:
• Articuno has a unique niche in the metagame thanks strong Ice-type STAB attacks and great bulk. Blizzard allows Articuno to tear through common cores utilizing Rillaboom, Landorus, and Raging Bolt.

  • Alolan Ninetales is mandatory with Articuno, patching up Blizzard's accuracy and amplifying its bulk and damage output through snow, Aurora Veil, and Helping Hand. Landorus makes for a great offensive partner, threatening Ice-resistant foes like Incineroar, Gholdengo, and Kingambit. Articuno is capable of removing Ground-immune foes like Dragonite and opposing Landorus in return.

  • Articuno's lack of coverage means aforementioned Ice resists such as Incineroar, Gholdengo, and Kingambit are problematic. Opposing weather from setters like Sunny Day and Rain Dance Tornadus are also an issue, as Articuno becomes a lot easier to remove without the added bulk and accurate Blizzards.

Choice Specs.description:
• Blizzard is used as Articuno's primary Ice-type STAB move, as it threatens both opponents. Ice Beam is used for a strong single-target attack, and Freeze-Dry is chosen to threaten Water-types like Ogerpon-W, Urshifu-R, and Terastallized Amoonguss, which otherwise take it's hits exceptionally well. Sheer Cold is preferred in the last moveslot to threaten bulky Ice-resistant foes such as Incineroar, Dondozo, and Kingambit.

  • Choice Specs allows Articuno to 2HKO Flutter Mane and Terastallized Ogerpon-W with Ice Beam and Freeze-Dry, respectively.

  • The given EV spread lets Articuno almost always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam and almost always survive Ogerpon-H's Tera Fire Ivy Cudgel under snow and Aurora Veil.

  • Articuno utilizes Tera Ice to shed its weakness to Raging Bolt's Thunderclap and keep the Defense boost from snow as well as make up for its mediocre damage output. This is because snow and Aurora Veil allow Articuno to function in seemingly bad matchups without a defensive Tera type.

Dragonite.overview:
• Dragonite's great movepool, well-rounded stats, great ability in Inner Focus that makes it immune to Fake Out and Intimidate from Incineroar, and stellar matchups into threats like Urshifu-R, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W makes Dragonite a great Pokemon in Regulation F.

  • When holding a Choice Band, Dragonite becomes one of the scariest Pokemon in the metagame for its breaking power. Its best partner, Chien-Pao, supports it with Sword of Ruin and pressures Pokemon that prevent Extreme Speed, such as Indeedee and Flutter Mane. Dragonite and Chien-Pao also are good into Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W, making Dondozo and Tatsugiri, which struggle with these two, great partners as well.

  • Flutter Mane is also a great partner, as it breaks through Iron Hands and Gholdengo for Dragonite, while Dragonite is a great switch into Scarf Urshifu-R and Rillaboom.

Choice Band.description:
• Extreme Speed is a priority move that hits the majority of the metagame for neutral damage, making it ideal to lock into.

  • Aerial Ace allows Dragonite to OHKO Pokemon like Urshifu-R, Rillaboom, and Amoongus without having to be lock into Outrage. Aqua Jet is secondary priority and allows it to double up with its partner on Ghost-types like Flutter Mane, and Ice Spinner allows it to remove Indeedee-F's Psychic Terrain while still having coverage for Pokemon like Rillaboom and Amoongus.

  • Outrage is used as its Dragon-type STAB move and allows it to OHKO almost the entire metagame.

  • Stomping Tantrum gives coverage into Steel-types like Kingambit and Archaludon.

  • The Speed EVs allow Dragonite to outspeed Dragapult in Tailwind, with the remaining EVs maximize its Attack and round out its bulk, allowing it to live attacks such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam

  • Normal is used as the Tera type, boosting Dragonite's Extreme Speed to stellar levels of power and removing its weaknesses to common Fairy- and Ice-type moves.

Porygon2.overview:
• Porygon2 is one of the bulkiest Pokemon in the format with Eviolite, which allows it to set up Trick Room for it and its partners and beat most Pokemon in the format one-on-one with Recover. With a Download Special Attack boost, it is able to OHKO Pokemon such as the Landorus formes, Tornadus, and Dragonite with Ice Beam.

  • Porygon2 appreciates redirection, damage reduction, and Fake Out support to set up Trick Room and to allow it to Recover safely, making Amoonguss, Ogerpon-W, Gouging Fire, and Incineroar excellent partners. Amoonguss especially benefits from Trick Room, since it is able to utilize its low Speed under Trick Room to incapacitate foes with Spore. Ursaluna is also a great partner for Porygon2, since, as a slow and offensive Pokemon, it appreciates Trick Room letting it deal great damage to faster foes that threaten it outside of Trick Room like Flutter Mane and Urshifu. This damage output is something that Porygon2 lacks.

  • Porygon2 struggles against Snarl, Taunt, Amoonguss, Incineroar, and Urshifu. Snarl makes it deal significantly less damage, which allows opponents to ignore it without being punished. Taunt removes valuable options from Porygon2 such as Trick Room and Recover. Spore from Amoonguss can stop Trick Room setups and makes Porygon2 vulnerable to strong attacks such as Close Combat from Urshifu, Moonblast from Flutter Mane, and Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao without being able to heal the damage off with Recover. Amoonguss also underspeeds Porygon2, punishing Trick Room setups, meaning that once Trick Room is set up, Amoonguss can Spore Porygon2 before it attacks, removing its access to recovery and damage. Incineroar pressures Fake Out, which helps stop Trick Room. Additionally, Incineroar can use Knock Off to remove the Eviolite from Porygon2, making it easier to KO. Finally, Urshifu can threaten Porygon2 with a 2HKO with Close Combat if Porygon2 does not Terastallize.

Offensive TR Setter.description:
• Tera Blast is used as strong Normal-type STAB move that offers coverage once Porygon2 Terastallizes. When Tera Blast is paired with a Download Attack boost, Tera Blast becomes a physical move when Porygon2 Terastallizes. This allows you to hit Assault Vest users like Raging Bolt and Rillaboom harder, as well as Pokemon with high base Special Defense such as Flutter Mane. Ice Beam is used as coverage against Landorus and Amoonguss, and Recover is used for longevity, allowing it to set Trick Room up multiple times.

  • With the bulk investment bolstered by the Eviolite, this Porygon2 always survives three Sacred Swords from Chien-Pao, Timid Choice Specs Chi-Yu Overheat, and two Moonblasts from Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane. It also almost always lives a Sword of Ruin Close Combat from Adamant Urshifu.

  • Tera Poison is the main Tera type for Porygon2. It offers resistances to Grass-, Fighting-, and Fairy-type attacks, which are important against Rillaboom, Urshifu, and Flutter Mane, respectively, as well as offering a solid overall defensive typing. Additionally, it allows it to hit Grass- and Fairy-types like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Tera Fairy Flutter Mane for super effective damage with Tera Blast. Tera Fairy is used to wall Urshifu and hit it and Raging Bolt for super effective damage. Tera Flying is used to hit Grass- and Fighting-types like Urshifu, Ogerpon, and Rillaboom. Additionally, it makes Porygon2 immune to Earthquake from Ursaluna, giving its partner a valuable spread move. Finally, Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to Fighting-type attacks and Fake Out, as well as giving it the ability to hit Flutter Mane.

Smeargle.overview:
• Smeargle is a Pokemon with access to a strong supportive movepool, allowing it to function as a niche supportive option with great role compression.

  • Smeargle works well alongside Urshifu-S, especially Choice Band variants. Along with Follow Me support, Wide Guard can protect Urshifu from common super effective spread moves like Dazzling Gleam and Bleakwind Storm.

  • Smeargle's biggest weakness is its abysmal stats, necessitating the use of Focus Sash in order to give it any survivability. Due to its dreadful Attack stat, it cannot provide any offensive pressure outside of Endeavor, and so it is almost completely reliant on its partner to deal damage.

Support.description:
• Burning Bulwark can be used to dissuade Fake Out and potentially burn physical attackers; however, Spiky Shield can be considered to block certain status effects and bypass opposing Focus Sashes.

  • Decorate can punish passive play in front of Fake Out pressure and should be used alongside Pokemon slower than Smeargle in order to immediately threaten +2 attacks.

  • The invested bulk allows Smeargle to survive a Tachyon Cutter from Iron Crown and almost always survive a Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R after Terastallizing into Grass.

  • Tera Grass is generally preferred to be immune to Spore, though Tera Ghost can be used for a Fake Out immunity.

Entei.overview:
• Entei is a strong offensive threat thanks to its amazing movepool, and access to Sacred Fire and Extreme Speed. Its great defensive stats combined with the immunity to Fake Out and Intimidate given by Inner Focus make it difficult to slow down. When next to Chien-Pao, it can threaten to OHKO on metagame staples Kingambit, Rillaboom, and frailer Flutter Mane sets.

  • As mentioned above, Chien-Pao is a great partner for Entei as Its Sword of Ruin ability helps Entei get KOs more easily. Chien-Pao can also remove Indeedee-F's Psychic Terrain with Ice Spinner, allowing Entei to click Extreme Speed. Another great partner for Entei is Raging Bolt, which, with its powerful Electric-type moves, especially Thunderclap, can pressure foes resistant to Sacred Fire such as Urshifu-R. Ogerpon-W is also a great partner that can redirect Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes or threaten it with a strong Horn Leech.

  • Despite its strengths, Entei struggles against bulky Water- and Fire- types like Urshifu-R, Terastallized Ogerpon-W, Incineroar, and Gouging Fire, which resist Sacred Fire. All of them also either resist Chien-Pao's Ice-type STAB move or can mitigate it and Entei's damage output. Entei also faces issues against Farigiraf, which blocks Extreme Speed.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Snarl slows down strong special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Iron Crown. Tera Blast can be used instead when using Tera Grass to hit Water-types.

  • Assault Vest helps increase Entei's longevity against special attackers such as Flutter Mane, making Entei even harder to remove taking into account Sacred Fire's burn chance.

  • The EV spread allows Entei to survive a 116 Special Attack Modest Earth Power from Landorus and, when Terastallized, almost always survive Mystic Water Urshifu-R's Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes, the rest of the EVs are used to maximize its damage output.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Water- and Ground- types like Urshifu-R and Landorus, as well as granting a Spore immunity. Tera Normal boosts Entei's Extreme Speed power while also removing its original weaknesses.

Offensive Weather Support.description:
Pelipper's access to Drizzle and Wide Guard in a metagame full of spread moves and weather control allow it to thrive as a support Pokemon with the threat of strong STAB options. Wide Guard is an excellent utility move, which not only protects its partner but, along with Pelipper's typing, also allows it to counter many Restricted Pokemon such as Groudon, Koraidon, both Calyrex formes, and Kyogre. Weather Ball and Hurricane's high Base Power make up for Pelipper's middling Special Attack, nuking most targets weak to its STAB moves, such as both Urshifu formes and Incineroar. Protect is generally preferred for utility and to block Fake Out, but Helping Hand can be used to support its teammates, thanks to moving before Fake Out. Focus Sash is needed to guarantee Pelipper can remain a threat even when facing one of the many Pokemon that can hit it for super effective damage. Tera Ghost is a generally strong Tera type and allows Pelipper to dodge Fake Out, which is especially important because it threatens to break Focus Sash. Tera Stellar is also viable to boost Pelipper's damage.

Any Pokemon that benefits from rain or Wide Guard appreciates Pelipper's support. Calyrex-I, Zacian-C, and Urshifu-R all value Pelipper's support, with Wide Guard blocking super effective Astral Barrages and Precipice Blades and rain boosting Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. Other support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Incineroar are also strong with Pelipper defensively, with it handling threats such as Urshifu-R and Landorus for Incineroar and Wide Guard blocking Bleakwind Storms from hitting Amoonguss. Its low Speed tier means it's essentially useless against Pokemon that can exploit its Speed and bring it down to its Focus Sash, leaving Pelipper unable to do anything without the threat of being knocked out. Opposing weather also completely cripples Pelipper, as its moves rely on rain to be consistent; however, its lower Speed compared to most weather setters means this scenario is playable, with rain more commonly lasting its five turns. Fake Out and other priority moves that can break Focus Sash easily are also devastating.

Rain Setter.description:
• Pelipper can use Wide Guard over Protect to block spread move, most notably Iron Crown's Expanding Force. Pelipper utilizes Weather Ball to obtain strong boosted STAB, threatening Incineroar and Landorus.

  • Pelipper utilizes Rocky Helmet to provide useful chip damage against Fake Out users, Ice Spinner Chien-Pao, and Urshifu-R, but can use Focus Sash for survivability or Damp Rock to extend rain for slower teams.

  • When using Focus Sash, Pelipper should use an alternative spread of 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with a Modest or Timid nature instead, foregoing bulk.

  • The EV spread helps Pelipper survive a Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast and almost always a Miracle Seed Rillaboom's Wood Hammer. The Speed investment allows Pelipper to outspeed Ogerpon when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Steel helps Pelipper gain resistances to strong threats like Rillaboom and Flutter Mane, giving it a turn to set Tailwind or click Hurricane. Tera Flying can be used to boost Pelipper's damage output and, when fully invested in Special Attack, threaten Amoonguss for an OHKO. Tera Ghost makes Pelipper immune to common moves, being Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Torkoal.overview:
• Torkoal is a premier offensive Pokemon seen on Trick Room teams thanks to its great STAB moves, fantastic ability, and good defenses. Its low Speed also makes it faster than most of the tier when in Trick Room, and it has great matchups into Pokemon like Amoonguss

  • Some of Torkoal's strongest partners are Trick Room setters like Cresselia and Farigiraf, which can help set up Trick Room and protect it from damage with Ally Switch and Armor Tail, respectively. Torkoal also pairs well with other Pokemon that benefit from Trick Room like Ursaluna-B and Iron Hands, which can threaten neutral damage onto most of the tier, notably threatening Pokemon like Raging Bolt and Tera Water Ogerpon-W, respectively.

  • Torkoal struggles against bulky Pokemon that resist Fire like Raging Bolt, Incineroar, as well as Tera Water Ogerpon-W, and Assault Vest Rillaboom, as they can withstand its boosted Eruptions and burn Trick Room turns, making partners like Ursaluna-B, Amoonguss, and Rillaboom appreciated.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Earth Power hits foes that resist Fire like Entei, Incineroar, Arcanine-Hisui, and Raging Bolt.

  • Charcoal boosts the damage of Torkoal's Fire-type moves, letting it OHKO Assault Vest Kingambit.

  • Tera Fire further bolsters Torkoal's Fire-type moves, letting it even 2HKO foes that resist Fire like Raging Bolt, Chi-Yu, and Tera Water Amoonguss.

Metagross.overview:
• Metagross serves as a good defensive Pokemon on balance teams thanks to its great defenses that are bolstered even further by Assault Vest, its good ability, and its nice defensive typing against foes like Raging Bolt and Iron Crown. Its access to coverage and high Attack stat make it appreciated as an offensive threat too.

  • Metagross can pair well with offensive Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Landorus, which can help deal with the Dark-, Ghost-, and Fire-types that threaten it like Urshifu-S, Gholdengo, and Entei. Another excellent partner can be Ogerpon-W, which has great synergy with Metagross, being able to deal with Ground-types like Landorus and redirect Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao, while Metagross can help Ogerpon-W against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt.

  • Before Terastallizing, Metagross can be overwhelmed by Pokemon like Kingambit, Chi-Yu, and Entei, making defensive partners like Amoonguss and Incineroar appreciated. Rillaboom can also be a good teammate for Metagross, providing it with passive recovery and utility via Grassy Terrain and Fake Out, respectively.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Stomping Tantrum lets Metagross hit Fire- and Steel-types likeIncineroar, Entei, and Kingambit and can also help against targets like Raging Bolt. Stomping Tantrum in particular is important to hit Steel-types like Iron Crown, as they wall Metagross's STAB moves.

  • Bullet Punch can be used to help pick off weakened foes like Flutter Mane.

  • With an Assault Vest, Metagross can almost always survive Earth Power from Landorus

  • With the given EV spread, Metagross almost always survives Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao when using Tera Dragon, and it is only 3HKOed by -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword when using Tera Steel. The Speed EVs let it outspeed -1 Adamant Landorus-T, as well as Roaring Moon and Adamant Chien-Pao when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Dragon lets Metagross handle Fire-types like Chi-Yu and Entei in a pinch, and it can also be useful to deal with Water-types like Ogerpon-W and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Tera Steel helps remove its weakness against Pokemon like Kingambit, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao, and it can also give Bullet Punch a chance to OHKO offensive Flutter Mane.

Registeel.overview:
• With an extremely high Defense stat and access to the coveted IronPress combination, Registeel serves the role of the format's late-game sweeper. Steel is an incredibly good typing defensively, and Clear Body stops Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar, which could otherwise prevent the OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Registeel fits best on balance teams that feature its favorite partners. Incineroar and Amoonguss can slow down the pace of the game, Latias provides crucial speed control in Tailwind, and Rillaboom's Grassy Surge and Fake Out is appreciated by Registeel. Additionally, Latias and Rillaboom threaten Urshifu-R. Similarly, Raging Bolt is also a good Registeel partner, being the premier Urshifu-R counter in the format.

  • Notable good matchups for Registeel include Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W, both of which get cleanly 2HKOed by Body Press after a single Iron Defense boost. Kingambit also does poorly against Registeel, as Swords Dance can be mitigated by Iron Defense and Body Press hits Kingambit very hard if it does not Terastallize.

  • However, not all physical attackers are helpless against the IronPress Registeel. Both Urshifu formes can pose a threat, depending on Registeel's choice of Tera type. Chien-Pao can threaten heavy damage with Sacred Sword if Registeel has not used Terastallization. Gholdengo is also a hard counter to Registeel, as it is immune to Body Press and resists Heavy Slam while also being able to set up with Nasty Plot and break through Registeel's high bulk.

IronPress.description:
• Heavy Slam allows Registeel to hit opposing Ghost-types like Flutter Mane. 52 Attack EVs allow Heavy Slam to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane.

  • Leftovers keeps it healthy throughout the game, with Protect providing additional turns of recovery.

  • Tera Water is the standard Tera Type for Registeel, allowing it to resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and being a generally good defensive typing. However, with the rise of Urshifu-S, Tera Fairy is a viable option to resist Wicked Blow and Fighting-type moves while also being neutral into the majority of the metagame. Be careful using this, however as Teratallized Urshifu-R threatens a 2HKO with Surging Strikes, and Landorus can easily pin you with Earth Power and Sludge Bomb.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Registeel to almost always survive Timid Earth Power from Landorus. The rest of the Defense EVs along with an Impish nature maximize its damage output.

Latias.overview:
• Latias is an exceptional Tailwind setter thanks to its great bulk, defensive typing, Levitate, and solid Speed. It also checks common threats such as Landorus and Urshifu-R.

  • Assault Vest Kingambit is a great partner, beating most of Latias's counters like Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and, to an extent, Incineroar. It also makes great use of Tailwind, and Latias beats most of its counters as well.

  • Latias can be very tough to remove especially if it Terastallizes into a Poison-type, which, when combined with Levitate, has only one weakness and many valuable resistances. This becomes extra apparent when using Recover, which lets it clean up late-game when positioned well, especially if Mist Ball gets some Special Attack drops.

Bulky Tailwind Setter.description:
• Ice Beam is great coverage in general and very important for OHKOing Landorus, one of Latias's best and most important matchups.

  • Rocky Helmet lets Latias punish common and important moves like Fake Out and U-turn. It also breaks Chien-Pao's Focus Sash if it opts to run Ice Spinner and heavily discourages the prevalent Urshifu-R from attacking it.

  • The Speed EVs allow it to outspeed max Speed Landorus, the Special Attack EVs let it OHKO Urshifu-R and Landorus more consistently, and the rest of the EVs are used to optimize its bulk.

  • Tera Poison, when paired with Levitate, makes Latias very difficult to break, as Psychic-types, besides opposing Latias, are not common, and the Poison typing offers resistances to many relevant offensive types, the most important of which being Fairy, because of Flutter Mane.

Bulky 3 Attacks.description:
Kyogre is one of the top Restricted Pokemon in the metagame due to its high Special Attack and access to some of the strongest STAB moves in Water Spout and Origin Pulse, which can OHKO top threats like Incineroar, Ogerpon-H, Flutter Mane and bulkless Zacian-C. Its ability, Drizzle, takes its offensive output to outrageous levels while also facilitating the rain offense archetype. Its base 90 Speed allows it to function in both Tailwind and Trick Room. Origin Pulse allows Kyogre to deal consistent damage if it loses HP, which reduces the power of Water Spout. Hydro Pump is another great option, which allows Kyogre to have a strong Water-type move which isn't spread, allowing it to play better against Wide Guard. Ice Beam can threaten Grass- and Dragon-types like Amoonguss and Koraidon, which take resisted damage from Kyogre's Water-type STAB moves. Mystic Water allows Kyogre to OHKO Calyrex-S and Kingambit with Water Spout, which also allows Kyogre to use defensive Tera type. The EV spread allows Kyogre to survive a -1 Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and take two Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrages from Calyrex-S. The investment in Special Attack allows it to 2HKO Zamazenta-C with Origin Pulse. Tera Grass helps Kyogre defensively against Pokemon like Rillaboom and Raging Bolt as well as providing a Spore immunity.

Kyogre matches up poorly against Pokemon like Rillaboom, Raging Bolt and Ogerpon-W. Landorus is a great partner, as it takes on all of these with Earth Power and Sludge Bomb. It also struggles against faster Tailwind teams, which can threaten early damage, weakening its Water Spout significantly. This can be patched up by using Urshifu-R, which outspeeds most of the metagame with a Choice Scarf and threatens high damage. Amoonguss is quite annoying for Kyogre as well, threatening Spore while taking resisted damage. However, Tornadus, a great partner to Kyogre, can shut it down with Taunt while also providing Prankster Tailwind and Rain Dance, which can be used to reset weather against Groudon and Terapagos-S. Archaludon has great defensive synergy with Kyogre, switching into Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, as well as taking the opportunity to start setting up with Electro Shot.

Assault Vest.description:
Kyogre is a strong Restricted Pokemon thanks to its enormous special bulk, which is further bolstered by Assault Vest, and great damage output thanks to its rain. These traits make it especially threatening in the metagame, as some of the best Restricted Pokemon like Terapagos and Calyrex-S struggle to break through Kyogre, while it continuously damages them with powerful rain-boosted STAB moves. Origin Pulse is a strong STAB move that Kyogre can use as it loses HP. Thunder can punish opposing Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W. Ice Beam threatens Grass- and Dragon-types like Amoonguss, Koraidon, and Miraidon. The EV spread allows Kyogre to survive a Choice Specs Helping Hand-boosted Draco Meteor from Miraidon and lets it take three Tera Ghost Astral Barrages from Calyrex-S. The investment in Speed lets Kyogre outspeed Calyrex-S and Choice Scarf Modest Chi-Yu in Tailwind. The Special Attack investment allows Kyogre to OHKO Incineroar with Origin Pulse. Tera Grass helps Kyogre defensively against Pokemon like Miraidon, Rillaboom, and Raging Bolt while providing a Spore immunity, which helps against Amoonguss.

Kyogre struggles against Pokemon like Miraidon, Rillaboom, Raging Bolt, and Ogerpon-W, as they resist Kyogre's STAB moves and threaten it with their respective STAB moves. Iron Jugulis is a premier Tailwind setter for Kyogre-based teams, since it can reduce the damage output of Pokemon like Miraidon and Raging Bolt with Snarl and threaten Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W with Hurricane. Faster Tailwind teams can be annoying, as they chip Kyogre before it can move, reducing its Water Spout damage. This can be solved by using Urshifu-R, which outspeeds most of the metagame with a Choice Scarf and threatens high damage with Surging Strikes, which can be boosted by Kyogre's rain. Tsareena is a good teammate for Assault Vest Kyogre, threatening Dragon- and Grass-types like Miraidon and Rillaboom with Triple Axel while also shutting down common priority attacks that threaten Kyogre like Grassy Glide from Rillaboom and Thunderclap from Raging Bolt with Queenly Majesty. Taunt on Tsareena helps Kyogre handle Amoonguss as well as Trick Room setters like Farigiraf.

Gallade.overview:
• Gallade is a strong option on Trick Room teams thanks to its high physical damage output, unique coverage and utility movepool. It can deal with many problematic matchups for Trick Room, such as set up sweepers via Sacred Sword and spread moves via Wide Guard.

  • Gallade is used on teams with Indeedee-F, as the Fighting-type coverage it provides is crucial in dealing with Incineroar, Ting-Lu and other Dark-types that give Trick Room sweepers such as Hatterene trouble. Sharpness-boosted Sacred Sword does massive damage, putting pressure on opponents from turn one, as well as checking several problematic matchups, such as Dondozo. Wide Guard removes the most common way to bypass Indeedee-F's Follow Me, spread moves, and presents mind games on opponents on whether Gallade will use Wide Guard or set up Trick Room.

  • Gallade's typing is amazing offensively, but defensively leaves much to be desired. Its Defense and HP are low, making it vulnerable to attackers like Rillaboom and Urshifu that can take one attack from Gallade while OHKOing it back. While its Special Defense is high, it is made moot by relevant special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Tornadus, which both resist Sacred Sword and hit it for super effective damage. However, it should be noted that Wide Guard blocks both Bleakwind Storm and Dazzling Gleam.

Trick Room Abuser.description:
• Psycho Cut and Sacred Sword are the highest base power moves that take advantage of Sharpness.

  • The Defense EVs allow Gallade to survive a Wicked Blow and Surging Strikes from Urshifu-S and Urshifu-R, respectively.

  • Tera Grass allows Gallade to ignore powder moves from Amoonguss, a common Trick Room counter, and resist common physical attackers such as Rillaboom. Alternatively, Tera Fire can be used to resist common anti-Trick Room leads such as Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane, as well as giving Gallade a Fairy resist.

Heatran.overview:
• Heatran is a niche bulky offensive threat thanks to its solid stats and great typing, bolstered by Flash Fire. This makes Heatran have an incredible matchup against most of the metagame, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

  • Rillaboom is a great partner for Heatran, as it resists Heatran's prominent weaknesses, while also hitting Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R for huge damage. Heatran also pairs well with Ogerpon-W, which supports Heatran with Follow Me, as well as threatening Urshifu-R and Landorus.

  • Although Heatran resists a lot of attacks with its typing, it's weak to both of the Urshifu formes, Ogerpon-W, Landorus, and Iron Hands. Heatran also faces tough Fire- and Steel- competition, especially with Incineroar.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The combination of Heatran's STAB moves, Heat Wave and Flash Cannon, can hit a lot of Pokemon in the metagame super-effectively, while Earth Power is a good coverage move that can hit Pokemon that resist Heatran's STAB combination, like Incineroar. Magma Storm is also another option as a Fire-type attack, as it traps the opponent, which works well with Leftovers.

  • Leftovers is a good item choice for Heatran, as it can live two Shadow Balls from Flutter Mane with a Special Attack-Booster Energy, and with Rillaboom's Grassy Surge, Heatran can constantly restore HP. Life Orb can increase Heatran's damage output, making it more of a threat.

  • 228 HP, 84 Defense EVs, and 20 Special Defense EVs allow Heatran to take an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, almost always survives a Sludge Bomb from Landorus after Heatran Terastallizes and Life Orb recoil, and finally, with 20 Speed EVs, Heatran outspeeds both Urshifu formes after a Speed drop.

  • Tera Grass is an excellent Tera type for Heatran, allowing it to resist Water- and Ground-type moves from the likes of Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Landorus. Tera Fairy can allow Heatran to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and be a neutral type against the metagame.

Cresselia.overview:
• Cresselia shines in VGC as an incredibly bulky Trick Room setter with access to Lunar Blessing. Cresselia is a great check to Amoonguss and Urshifu-R, nullifying Spore with Lunar Blessing and pressuring the latter with a 2HKO.

  • Cresselia's strongest partner is Ursaluna, as it's a strong Trick Room sweeper that appreciates Lunar Blessing negating the burn chip damage. Cresselia's Levitate also allows Ursaluna to freely click Earthquake. Cresselia also appreciates Pokemon like Amoonguss and Iron Hands, which help get up Trick Room and act as threats under Trick Room themselves.

  • Cresselia struggles against Incineroar, as Fake Out can allow Incineroar's partner to get off another hit, which can be the difference between setting up Trick Room and not. Cresselia also faces issues against Farigiraf, which can reverse or Imprison Trick Room. Tornadus can also prove to be difficult, as Taunt prevents Trick Room from going up and takes advantage of Cresselia's passivity.

Trick Room Support.description:
• Cresselia uses Moonblast to hit more of the metagame for super effective damage, including Urshifu-S, while Ice Beam can be used to threaten the Landorus formes and Dragonite. Cresselia may opt for Psychic for the extra power before Terastallization.

  • Helping Hand allows Cresselia to more actively support its partners, especially Ursaluna and its Earthquake. Cresselia can use Ally Switch to provide game-deciding mind games and a way to protect its partners in a pinch.

  • Cressellia uses Safety Goggles to protect itself from Amoonguss's Spore and be able to consistently protect its teammates with Lunar Blessing.

  • The EV spread allows Cresselia to almost always survive two Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, and always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Tera Fairy is the most consistent for Cresselia, as it provides a resistance to the common Dark-type moves such as Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow or Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave, as well as gaining STAB on Moonblast. Tera Poison is a generally good defensive typing further bolstered by Levitate, and it provides key resistances to Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Rillaboom's STAB moves.

Tailwind Support.description:
Whimsicott is an excellent Tailwind setter with a deep support movepool, mainly setting itself apart from Tornadus with its higher Speed, access to Encore and Helping Hand, and useful typing that gives it defensive utility against staples like Miraidon, Kyogre, Rillaboom, Raging Bolt, and both Urshifu formes. Moonblast provides a reliable STAB move that lets Whimsicott deal solid damage to common Fairy-weak Pokemon like Miraidon, Koraidon, Chien-Pao, and the Urshifu formes. Encore is Whimsicott's most infamous support option, letting it punish setup sweepers like Calm Mind Terapagos, IronPress Zamazenta-C, and Nasty Plot Calyrex-S for attempting to boost in front of it; the move also punishes foes from trying to stall out Tailwind turns with Protect, and it discourages Rillaboom from using Fake Out lest it be locked into it. Additionally, it forces Trick Room setters like Calyrex-I to untwist the dimensions. Taunt is a similarly useful disruption tool that can be used with or in place of Encore, notably allowing Whimsicott to deny Tailwind from other setters like Tornadus and Lunala unless they use Tera Dark. Protect helps Whimsicott keep itself on the field and stay in a position to use its other moves repeatedly, especially in the face of Fake Out users, but the last moveslot can also be spent on more aggressive options like Helping Hand, which is useful with any attacker, or Fake Tears, which is especially devastating alongside strong special threats like Chi-Yu. Whimsicott enjoys holding a Focus Sash to make up for its poor bulk, and Tera Ghost is useful to prevent the item from being wasted by Fake Out.

Whimsicott's reliable Tailwind support is a blessing to almost every Restricted Pokemon, especially those with middling Speed tiers such as Groudon, Calyrex-S, and Terapagos. All three of those Pokemon also benefit from Encore, which can create space for them to set up with Swords Dance, Nasty Plot, and Calm Mind, respectively. Clear Amulet Koraidon is another notable partner that reliably discourages opponents from bringing Incineroar, which is easily the worst Pokemon for Whimsicott to face in a battle. Other strong attackers that benefit from Tailwind support are also great with it; Landorus and Urshifu-S both fall into this category, and Chi-Yu is a standout example because it augments Whimsicott's modest damage output with Beads of Ruin. Other setup Pokemon that enjoy Encore are especially useful to justify using Whimsicott on a team over Tornadus, including Calm Mind Raging Bolt, Swords Dance Ogerpon-H, and Nasty Plot Gholdengo. It's important to make sure Whimsicott has teammates that can deal with problematic Dark-types like Chi-Yu, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit due to their Prankster immunity, and a Fighting-type like Urshifu-R or Iron Hands can help with that significantly.

Sun Setter.description:
• Moonblast keeps Whimsicott from being passive and hits threats like Raging Bolt and Urshifu-S for super effective damage.

  • Whimsicott can opt for Beat Up instead, allowing it to trigger Annihilape's Rage Fist and Terrakion's Justified ability.

  • Sunny Day activates Pokemon like Flutter Mane and Raging Bolts's abilities, making them more potent threats, as well as weakening Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • The fourth move slot is customizable; Fake Tears allows Whimsicott to weaken Pokemon for partners like Flutter Mane and Landorus, Encore locks foes into unfavorable moves like Protect and Fake Out, Taunt helps shut down more passive Pokemon like Amoonguss and opposing Whimsicott.

  • The EV spread allows Whimsicott to live Tornadus's Bleakwind Storm and outspeed Maximum Speed Tornadus.

  • Tera Water grants Whimsicott valuable resistances to Fire-, Ice-, and Steel-types like Incineroar, Chien-Pao, and Kingambit while generally being a great defensive typing.

  • Covert Cloak allows Whimsicott to be immune to Fake Out.

Offensive Utility.description:
• Protect is valuable for dealing with Fake Out, but it does not allow to fit Sunny Day.

  • Tera Ghost makes Whimsicott immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed as well as providing a resistance to Poison-type moves like Landorus' Sludge Bomb.

  • Focus Sash allows Whimsicott to have another chance to set up Tailwind or support its team later on in the game, as its mediocre defensive stats and plethora of weaknesses otherwise leave it potentially OHKOd by most Pokemon in the metagame.

  • Note that if Whimsicott is running Beat Up, an EV spread of 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly Nature is more optimal.

Supportive Trapper.description:
Gothitelle's Shadow Tag and vast supportive movepool provide it with a unique niche in Regulation G, allowing its partners to take full advantage of lead matchups. Gothitelle utilizes Foul Play as its offensive move to threaten the Calyrex formes. Taunt helps Gothitelle trap and shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Clefairy. Helping Hand can make up for Gothitelle's lack of offensive pressure; however, Protect can be used instead on Safety Goggles sets to protect against Fake Out. Covert Cloak protects Gothitelle from Fake Out, while Safety Goggles allows Gothitelle to ignore Spore and Rage Power from Amoonguss. The EV spread lets Gothitelle survive Flutter Mane's Choice Specs Shadow Ball and Adamant Koraidon's Flare Blitz, as well as avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Tera Starstorm from Terapagos-S. Tera Dark is used to grant Gothitelle a resistance to Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, Incineroar's Knock Off, and Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, as well as an immunity to Prankster Taunt from Tornadus. Tera Dark also boosts Foul Play, allowing Gothitelle to threaten an OHKO on Calyrex-S and +1 Attack Calyrex-I.

Gothitelle partners especially well with hyper offensive teams, as Shadow Tag makes it easier to remove crucial pieces from the opponent's team. This is especially prevalent with Koraidon, as Gothitelle prevents Pelipper from switching in and significantly weakening Koraidon. Gothitelle trapping Pokemon that struggle to threaten Koraidon like the Ogerpon formes also allows Koraidon to set up for a sweep through Flame Charge. Choice Specs Terapagos also appreciates Gothitelle, as Gothitelle can trap the opponent's Fake Out user and Taunt Amoonguss, minimizing issues for Terapagos throughout the game. Gothitelle can also utilize its own Fake Out to help Terapagos remove Urshifu-R, which is otherwise problematic. Raging Bolt can pick off Pokemon with Thunderclap and shut down special attackers with Snarl significantly easier thanks to Gothitelle's trapping. Gothitelle struggles with Flutter Mane and Pokemon that can pivot like Rillaboom and Incineroar, as it can't trap them and does minimal damage with Foul Play. The aforementioned Koraidon can remove all of these checks reliably.

Amoonguss.overview:
• Amoonguss excels as a support Pokemon thanks to its great defensive typing and toolkit. Regenerator gives Amoonguss longevity and allows it to constantly answer Urshifu-R, Iron Hands, and Flutter Mane with Rage Powder throughout the game.

  • Amoonguss appreciates Incineroar allowing it to pivot to activate Regenerator, as well as the Intimidate and Fake Out support Incineroar provides after pivoting in. Incineroar also helps Amoonguss by pressuring the powder-immune Grass-types and weakening threats like Chien-Pao and opposing Incineroar, while Amoonguss can keep it healthy through Pollen Puff and protect it from Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane in return.

  • Amoonguss also pairs well with frail offensive Pokemon like Urshifu-R, which threatens problematic Fire-types like Incineroar and Entei. Amoonguss can also protect Urshifu-R from Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt through Rage Powder.

  • Amoonguss struggles against Pokemon like Entei and Chi-Yu, which threaten to OHKO it, as well as Grass-types like Rillaboom or opposing Amoonguss who can ignore it. Ogerpon-W with Follow Me can be an issue because it restricts Amoonguss from putting foes to sleep.

Bulky Support.description:
• Amoonguss can use Spore to disable the majority of the metagame and enable offensive partners in the process. It can also use Pollen Puff to keep its partners healthy as well as pressure Ogerpon-W with super effective chip damage

  • Amoonguss can utilize Sitrus Berry for burst healing and to survive the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball. It can also opt for Rocky Helmet to punish physical attackers, especially Urshifu-R.

  • The HP EVS optimize Sitrus Berry recovery, and in conjunction with the Defense and Special Defense EVs, it survives the OHKO from Adamant Chien-Pao Ice Spinner and the 2HKO from Gholdengo's Shadow Ball, respectively.

  • Amoonguss makes use of Tera Water, as it synergizes with its original typing while keeping a resistance to Water. This enables it to take on Entei, Chien-Pao, and Incineroar while keeping its role as a consistent Urshifu-R answer. This is great for Amoonguss as many of these Pokemon like to partner together. Tera Fairy can be used instead to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and not be vulnerable to Ogerpon-W after Terastallizing.

Volcarona.overview:
• Volcarona is a great setup Pokemon thanks to the superb Quiver Dance and great stats across the board. Volcarona can consistently set up in front of Rillaboom, Raging Bolt, Gholdengo, and, to an extent, Flutter Mane, thanks to its typing and a relatively fast Quiver Dance.

  • Volcarona appreciates redirection from Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss, Intimidate Pokemon such as Incineroar and Landorus-T, and Fake Out Pokemon like Rillaboom. All of these generate free turns for Volcarona to set up for a sweep. Rillaboom also provides it with Grassy Terrain recovery, which can make Volcarona extremely hard to bring down.

  • Volcarona struggles against Fire-type physical attackers like Incineroar, Entei, and Terastallized Ogerpon-H, which wall it and threaten it for massive damage without the fear of being burned. Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W also force a Terastallization, though they can be handled if Volcarona sets up enough Quiver Dances.

Quiver Dance.description:
• Volcarona prefers Flamethrower as its Fire-type STAB move for the OHKO on Amoonguss at +1 and the OHKOs on Assault Vest Rillaboom and Kingambit when at +2. Volcarona uses Tera Blast to threaten Raging Bolt and the Urshifu formes. Giga Drain can be used instead for longevity and a better way to threaten Tera Ogerpon-W.

  • Leftovers' recovery is most effective, as Volcarona is intended to stay on the field from start to finish, Giga Drain and common support enables this.

  • The EVs allow Volcarona to survive Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel, and, when Terastallized and at +1 Special Defense, two Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane Dazzling Gleams. The Speed investment allows for Volcarona to outspeed unboosted Iron Bundle after a Quiver Dance, and the remaining EVs are used to maximize damage.

  • Even when boosted, Volcarona will struggle against the aforementioned Fire-types, so Landorus and Urshifu-R make great teammates. Volcarona is a great answer to Flutter Mane and Rillaboom in return.

  • Volcarona prefers Tera Fairy to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves, while Tera Dragon is another option to resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Ogerpon-W's STAB moves. Both Tera types synergise with Volcarona's original typing, thanks providing Steel-, Ice-, and Fairy-type resistances.

Tailwind Support.description:
Tornadus is used as a support Pokemon that can set Tailwind for its team and deal semi-consistent damage with Bleakwind Storm. It is very good into Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom, as Tornadus can easily use Taunt or threaten them with Bleakwind Storm. Tornadus can make use of its weather-setting abilities to help itself hit Bleakwind Storms or to help support its teammates by boosting or reducing the damage of Water- or Fire-type moves. Icy Wind provides a secondary form of speed control for Tornadus and helps against other Tailwind-based teams. Protect can also help against Fake Out if it holds Rocky Helmet Covert Cloak allows Tornadus to shine as a supportive piece, as it stops it from being flinched by the common Fake Out. It also prevents it from having its Special Attack lowered by Snarl. Rocky Helmet acts more as a repellent for attacks like Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner. It also can make Pokemon more wary of using Fake Out, as they will be constantly taking chip damage. The EV spread on this Tornadus allows it to take a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R. This can be really impactful on the Rocky Helmet set, as it forces Urshifu-R down to 50% of its health upon hitting it. It can also take an Astral Barrage from Choice Specs Calyrex-S. Tera Dark is mainly used to stop other Tornadus from using Taunt or Whimsicott from using Encore on it. It can also be used as a defensive Tera against Calyrex-S, as it resists or is immune to both of its STAB attacks. Tera Steel can be used to resist attacks from Pokemon such as Chien-Pao and the occasional Rock-type. It also removes a weakness to Electric, which can make it fare better against Raging Bolt.

Tornadus is a good partner for many Pokemon thanks to its ability to support them through speed control and weather. One example of this is Chi-Yu, which makes use of Tornadus's ability to set sun and Tailwind to blast through opposing teams. Chi-Yu also helps Tornadus's Bleakwind Storms do more damage. Kyogre is another good partner, as Tornadus allows it to outspeed non-Tailwind teams with its below average Speed stat. Tornadus can also help to stop other weather teams from outdamaging Kyogre while letting Kyogre deal with opposing weather attackers. Tornadus benefits other Pokemon with its weather as well such as Urshifu-R, Koraidon and Archaludon. It can also provide a check to weather-setting Pokemon like Koraidon and Groudon with opposing weather. Checks to Tornadus include Miraidon and Raging Bolt. Their ability to resist its attacks and fire back with powerful Electric-type STAB moves can threaten both Tornadus and its common partners. One other check is Kingambit. Often, Tornadus cannot attack with Bleakwind Storm due to the threat of Defiant being activated. It can easily set up in front of Tornadus or, if it has Assault Vest, threaten its partner. Landorus, however, can help to beat some of these checks with strong Sandsear Storms in Rain while being immune to Miraidon's and Raging Bolt's Electric-type STAB moves. Trick Room teams are also a bad matchup, as they flip the Speed stats and make Tailwind useless. Calyrex-I is especially tough for Tornadus, as it can target it down with strong Glacial Lances or set Trick Room right in front of it.

Bulky Tailwind.description:
• Bleakwind Storm provides good damage into Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Tailwind is the most effective speed control Tornadus has access to. Taunt helps shut down Amoonguss and helps to manage certain Trick Room Pokemon like Porygon2 and Dusclops, but Protect can be run instead to ensure Tailwind goes up. Rain Dance and Sunny Day serve as weather control, which enables your sweepers and disables opposing weather-based sweepers. Rain Dance pairs well with Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W while Sunny Day powers up Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane.

  • This given EV spread focuses on bulk, surviving Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The low Speed investment ensures that Tornadus sets up its own weather.

  • Rocky Helmet helps against Urshifu-R mirrors and provides good chip into opposing physical attackers making contact. Covert Cloak prevents Fake Out flinches from Incineroar and Rillaboom. It also negates any secondary effects from moves like Rock Slide and Icy Wind. This ensures that Tailwind goes up. Mental Herb helps to shrug off one Taunt.

  • Tera Dark provides an immunity to Prankster Taunt, guaranteeing Tailwind. Tera Steel provides useful resistance to Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane's STAB moves. Both Tera types improve matchups into Psyspam and against Electric-type moves from Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Iron Hands and Archaludon.

Offensive Tailwind.description:
• Focus Sash ensures Tornadus survives one attack and set up Tailwind. Protect becomes important to avoid Fake Out without committing the Tera early.

  • Tornadus rarely Terastallizes, but Tera Ghost can ensure that it can more reliably set up Tailwind by negating Fake Out from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom, and Extreme Speed from Pokemon like Dragonite and Entei. Tera Flying increases its offensive pressure.

Life Orb.description:
Landorus is one of the strongest Pokemon in the metagame thanks to its access to strong Ground-type STAB moves in Earth Power and Sandsear Storm, which are further boosted by its ability, Sheer Force. In conjunction with Life Orb, Landorus can OHKO top metagame Pokemon like Incineroar, Zacian-C and Kingambit. Sludge Bomb allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-H while threatening huge damage to Assault Vest Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Substitute allows Landorus to stay on the field longer and avoid Amoonguss's Spore, which allows it to deal continuous damage. Tera Poison allows Landorus to OHKO Ogerpon-W with Sludge Bomb, while shedding weaknesses to common attacks like Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao; it also allows Landorus to deal great damage to common Tera Fairy users, like Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Tera Steel allows Landorus to resist Ice while also giving a neutrality against Water-type STAB moves from common Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W. The EV spread allows it to survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R while Terastallized and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The investment in Special Attack allows it to OHKO uninvested Urshifu-R safely.

Landorus has a poor matchup against Chien-Pao, Calyrex-I, and Kyogre, which can all OHKO Landorus. It also struggles against Tailwind teams, which can remove it before it can deal significant damage. Once Terastallized, Ogerpon-W threatens huge damage on Landorus, while also taking reduced damage from Sludge Bomb. Kyogre sets up rain with Drizzle, allowing Landorus to spam Life-Orb boosted Sandsear Storm without any accuracy drawbacks. Tornadus sets up Tailwind, letting Landorus move before non-Tailwind teams. In return, Landorus threatens Raging Bolt, which generally threatens both Tornadus and Kyogre.

Landorus-Therian.overview:
• A great STAB combination, a sky-high Attack stat, and Intimidate allow Landorus-T to function well in many different roles. These make it a great Choice Band sweeper, threatening many common metagame threats such as Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Landorus-T can also function as a Intimidate pivoter, using its great STAB combination and movepool to provide utility.

  • More offensive Landorus-T sets appreciate speed control support from Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, with the former being more consistent by providing Tailwind support and hitting the Grass-types that resist Ground such as Rillaboom, while the latter has excellent offensive synergy. Redirection support from Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss is also appreciated, with both benefiting from Intimidate and Ogerpon-W specifically handling the Ice- and Water-types that give Landorus-T trouble. Choice Scarf Landorus-T partners well with all of the above options; however, it doesn't rely on speed control compared to Choice Band variants.

  • Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W are difficult for Landorus-T to handle, with the former having Fake Out. which is even more potent because Landorus-T almost exclusively runs Choice items, and halving the damage of Earthquake, while the latter has super effective Water-type STAB moves and a way to redirect its Stomping Tantrum; both of these also resist Ground. Incineroar is also an issue, as even though it's weak to Ground, Intimidate and Parting Shot let it constantly debuff Landorus-T, removing the its potential to OHKO many Pokemon. Landorus-T also finds itself difficult to slot into many teams, as each of its individual strong points are better found in other options, such as Incineroar generally being a strong Intimidate pivot and the other Landorus forme being a better offensive threat.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is the best single target Ground-type move available, while Earthquake is used to dish out damage to more foes and bypass Follow Me. Rock Slide hits the Flying-types that are immune to Ground, while U-turn is a strong pivot option that also hits Ground-resistant Grass-types, even having a chance to OHKO frailer Ogerpon formes.

  • Choice Band allows Landorus-T to function as a sweeper, partially negating the low Base Power of its Ground-type moves and giving it rolls to OHKO many prevalent threats such as Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Flutter Mane.

  • The Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S, Kowtow Cleave from a +1 Attack Black Glasses Kingambit, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Special Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Chien-Pao at -1, with the rest being put into Attack.

  • Tera Fairy is generally preferred for being a stronger neutral type into the current metagame. It also resists Sucker Punch from Kingambit, which threatens big damage thanks to its ability Defiant, and other Dark-type attackers, allowing it to wall Urshifu-S.

Damage Oriented Pivot.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is used as the strongest Ground-type move available, with Rock Slide being coverage for Flying-types and U-turn for general utility. Tera Blast Flying gives Landorus-T a Flying-type move, despite coming at a high cost, allowing it to hit the Grass-types that otherwise resist Stomping Tantrum, as well as generally having more flexibility in the matchups it can be brought to.

  • Choice Scarf gives Landorus-T the jump on many of its counters such as Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-W and helps it pivot more easily with U-turn.

  • The EV spread still survives Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, with the Attack investment guaranteeing an OHKO on Rillaboom with Tera Blast Flying.

  • Tera Flying is used to give Landorus-T a Flying-type STAB move with Tera Blast and remove its Water-type weakness.

Sylveon.overview:
• Sylveon's solid natural bulk as well as access to absurd damage from Pixilate-boosted Hyper Voice makes it a solid setup sweeper. With its pure Fairy typing, Sylveon boasts a better matchup into Ghost- and Dark-type threats such as Flutter Mane and Urshifu-S than its main Fairy-type competition, Flutter Mane.

  • Sylveon appreciates support from Fake Out and Follow Me, allowing it to set up Throat Spray or Calm Mind more easily. Incineroar makes up for Sylveons middling physical bulk with Parting Shot and Intimidate, as well as handling the Steel- and Fire-types that Sylveon struggles against. Ogerpon-W not only provides Follow Me support but similarly to Incineroar is able to handle Steel- and Fire-type attacks safely. Landorus is a great offensive partner, with it and Sylveon covering each other's checks, as well as making up for Sylveon's low initial damage output.

  • Sylveon's biggest issue is that it struggles to find a slot on most teams due to its competition with Flutter Mane, which is more of an immediate threat thanks to its higher single target damage, higher Speed, and Fake Out immunity from its Ghost typing. While Sylveon has use cases thanks to its bulk and pure Fairy typing, Flutter Mane is easier to fit into most compositions and is able to function well with minimal support. Sylveon's middling Speed means it is vulnerable to being overwhelmed by foes, making utilizing its strong setup options difficult.

Throat Spray Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to utilize Throat Spray as well as being a strong spread move after the boost from Pixilate. Misty Terrain allows Sylveon to block Spore from Amoonguss, while Calm Mind is also viable as another way to further increase Sylveons damage output. Quick Attack picks off Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, which normally run Focus Sash. If Sylveon is running Tera Fire, Tera Blast is also an option to hit Fairy-resistant foes such as Amoonguss and Gholdengo, as well as being a strong single target Fairy-type move before Terastallization thanks to Pixilate.

  • The invested Defense allows Sylveon to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom, as well as Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W. Sylveon is also able to survive a Metal Coat-boosted Make It Rain from Gholdengo. Enough Speed is invested for Sylveon to outspeed Chi-Yu when under Tailwind, with the rest dumped into Special Attack.

  • Both Tera Fire and Water allow Sylveon to check problematic Steel- and Fire-types such as Gholdengo, Incineroar and Assault Vest Kingambit, though Tera Water is generally preferred thanks to having fewer weaknesses to common offensive threats. Tera Fire has valuable resistances to Fairy- and Grass-type moves on top of the coverage with Tera Blast; however, it makes Sylveon weak to more metagame threats, such as Landorus and Ogerpon-W.

Bulky Support.description:
Incineroar is the premier non-Restricted Pokemon in the Regulation G metagame thanks to Intimidate and its ability to check centralizing threats such as Calyrex-S for its team. Its access to Fake Out and Parting Shot combined with its great natural bulk make for a strong combination, demanding respect from foes lest they be forced to switch out, leaving themselves vulnerable to Incineroar's allies, or stay on the field outputting negligible damage. Incineroar is naturally blessed with a typing that lets it take on both Restricted Pokemon, such as Lunala and Calyrex-S, and strong non-Restricteds like Chien-Pao, Rillaboom, and Chi-Yu. Will-O-Wisp ruins IronPress Zamazenta-C and Clear Amulet Calyrex-I; this is of great value, as they normally are not hindered by Intimidate since the former relies on its Defense stat to deal damage and the latter almost always runs Clear Amulet. Alternatively, Flare Blitz provides high damage output against Rillaboom and Amoonguss and OHKOes Chien-Pao. Taunt can also be utilized on specific teams, such as those with Calyrex-I, to shut down Amoonguss. Knock Off is crucial to OHKO Calyrex-S while removing items such as Safety Goggles from opposing Incineroar to aid its own partner Amoonguss. Holding Safety Goggles itself allows Incineroar to have a better matchup against Amoonguss, letting it ignore Spore and Rage Powder, but Sitrus Berry can viably be run to provide crucial longevity to Incineroar in this powerful Restricted metagame. The given EV spread allows Incineroar to always survive a Jolly Close Combat from Mienshao. As an added bonus, it also takes a +1 Defense Body Press from Zamazenta-C, allowing it to use Will-O-Wisp or get better positioning against Zamazenta-C's allies. The special bulk EVs allow Incineroar to avoid a 2HKO from +1 Life Orb Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, letting it retaliate with Knock Off. 27 Speed IVs are run in order to get a slower Parting Shot than opposing Incineroar, allowing the user's Incineroar's Parting Shot to go off onto a freshly switched-in opposing Pokemon for greater value. Tera Ghost allows Incineroar to ignore Fake Out from opposing Incineroar or Rillaboom, Close Combat from Mienshao and either Urshifu forme, and Body Press from Zamazenta-C. Tera Grass lets Incineroar resist Water Spout from Kyogre while being immune to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder, essentially functioning as a built-in Safety Goggles. Alternatively, Tera Water can be used to keep the resistance to Water Spout and resist Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance in exchange for a neutral matchup against opposing Incineroar and being unable to ignore Amoonguss.

Incineroar pairs well with virtually every Restricted Pokemon, providing Fake Out support in conjunction with solid bulk and damage reduction. As useful as Incineroar is, it is severely threatened by Pokemon such as Koraidon and Kyogre, the former of which is immune to Intimidate thanks to Clear Amulet and can easily OHKO Incineroar with Collision Course. The latter is Incineroar's worst matchup, as it easily gets OHKOed by Water Spout and even Origin Pulse if rain is on the field. Miraidon is also a huge nuisance when used with Choice Specs, as it can either potentially OHKO Incineroar with Electro Drift or pivot around it with Volt Switch, chipping it or its allies down. The susceptibility to Koraidon can be mitigated by having Flutter Mane or Fairy Tera Raging Bolt as a partner, as both take advantage of Koraidon's sun via Protosynthesis and force it to Terastallize. Incineroar should also be carefully preserved against Calyrex-I because it commonly runs Clear Amulet and High Horsepower, which can 2HKO Incineroar. Incineroar also struggles against a top non-Restricted Pokemon in Urshifu-R, so allies such as Rillaboom and/or Amoonguss are appreciated to keep it and other threats like Kyogre and Miraidon in check.

Assault Vest Pivot.description:
• Assault Vest makes Incineroar even bulkier, at the cost of utility in not running Parting Shot or Safety Goggles.

  • The given EV spread allows Incineroar to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast and take Landorus's Earth Power, while the Defense EVs let Incineroar survive Close Combat from the Urshifu formes with Sword of Ruin active.

  • Tera Grass is preferred because it flips Incineroar's weaknesses and allows it to be a consistent Amoonguss answer, ignoring Spore and Rage Powder. Incineroar can also use Tera Fairy as a more all-round defensive typing and as a way to check Urshifu-S.

Kommo-o.overview:
• Kommo-o is a strong setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive stats and access to STAB Body Press. Its defensive typing gives it critical resistances to the signature moves of both Urshifu formes, which ignore the Defense boosts from Iron Defense. With proper support, Kommo-o is capable of becoming extremely difficult to remove once it starts setting up Iron Defense, making it an extremely effective sweeper.

  • Kommo-o appreciates teammates that help it set up more easily. Incineroar and Amoonguss are great at this, with Incineroar being able to cycle Fake Out and Parting Shot, while Amoonguss provides Spore as well as redirection support. Both give Kommo-o turns to set up and more room to maneuver, and they also have strong defensive synergy with Kommo-o. Ting-Lu is another great partner, as it can whittle down foes with Ruination, and its ability Vessel of Ruin makes Kommo-o harder to remove.

  • Ironically, one of Kommo-o's biggest weaknesses is its typing. While its numerous resistances are valuable, namely into the Ogerpon and Urshifu formes, in exchange, it is weak to a whole host of common offensive types. Strong attackers such as Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Chien-Pao hit Kommo-o for super effective damage, with the former two being special attackers and the latter using Sacred Sword, meaning they all ignore Iron Defense boosts. Kommo-o is often forced to Terastallize, and requires careful positioning around threats to conserve its HP for a late game sweep.

Iron Defense Sweeper.description:
• Iron Head is used to hit Flutter Mane, which is immune to Body Press.

  • Leftovers is used for extra recovery, since Kommo-o will be on the field for long periods of time.

  • Overcoat is picked for an immunity to powder moves, allowing it to ignore Amoonguss, which can otherwise redirect a resisted Body Press and slow it down with Spore.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Kommo-o to live a Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B and makes Shadow Ball from Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane a 3HKO. On the physical side, the Defense investment allows Kommo-o to comfortably live Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, as well as making Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow a 3HKO after Terastallizing into Steel. The Attack investment gives the best chance for an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Iron Head after Terastallizing into Steel.

  • Tera Steel has the best synergy with Kommo-o's original typing since it provides resistances to every type that Kommo-o is weak to. It also gives STAB to Iron Head, allowing for a favorable roll to OHKO Flutter Mane

Bulky Attacker.description:
Lunala is a strong bulky attacker with a great defensive ability in Shadow Shield, valuable support tools in Wide Guard and Trick Room, and the threatening Power Herb + Meteor Beam combination. Meteor Beam gives Lunala a strong setup option while having the extra benefit of doing major damage to Incineroar and other Pokemon weak to Rock. Lunala's access to Wide Guard paired with its Ghost typing gives it a favorable matchup into popular restricted Pokemon like Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C by blocking their strong STAB moves in Body Press and Glacial Lance, respectively. Trick Room allows Lunala to set the pace of the match to its favor, with Moonblast being a solid alternative to cover for Dark-types when speed control isn't necessary. The EV spread allows Lunala to take Wicked Blow and Life Orb-boosted Astral Barrage from Urshifu-S and Calyrex-S with Shadow Shield active. Tera Fairy removes Lunala's Dark and Ghost weaknesses while being a strong defensive typing itself, giving Lunala the opportunity to safely stay in against would-be checks like Incineroar and Flutter Mane while having the extra benefit of boosting Moonblast.

Lunala naturally struggles against Dark- and Normal-types like Incineroar and Terapagos, both taking negligible to no damage from Moongeist Beam once Power Herb is used up by Meteor Beam. Calyrex-S also forces Lunala to either use Wide Guard or Terastallize to avoid major damage. Urshifu-R is a phenomenal partner for Lunala, as it's able to cover Lunala's weaknesses and OHKO threatening Pokemon like Incineroar, Terapagos, and Calyrex-S; it is also protected by Lunala's Wide Guard from strong spread moves like Bleakwind Storm and Astral Barrage. Incineroar also forms a solid defensive backbone when paired with Urshifu-R as well as generating opportunities for Lunala to set up Trick Room with Fake Out. Amoonguss provides redirection support as well as Pollen Puff healing to keep Lunala at full HP for Shadow Shield; it also synergizes extremely well with Lunala's other common partners like Urshifu-R and Incineroar. Tailwind + Trick Room teams that run Lunala also benefit from strong Tailwind setters like Tornadus and Whimsicott, giving Lunala the flexibility to go for a fast game mode in specific matchups.

Rillaboom.overview:
• Rillaboom maintains its status as a premier Fake Out pivot thanks to U-turn, Grassy Glide, and Grassy Terrain. Rillaboom fits on many archetypes and has a wide range of playstyles. Rillaboom is a great counter to Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W, as it is able to switch into their attacks and pressure them for huge damage if not a KO.

  • Assault Vest Rillaboom is the most common set currently, as it checks Flutter Mane, and can switch in on special threats and threaten with Fake Out or Grassy Glide.

  • Common Rillaboom partners include Urshifu-R and Incineroar to complete the Fire / Water / Grass core, and more offensive sets pair well with Entei and Chien-Pao with priority spam. Other great partners are defensive Pokemon such as Calm Mind Raging Bolt that benefit from Grassy Terrain recovery and Fake Out.

  • Common Rillaboom checks include Fire-types, Intimidate Pokemon to greatly reduce Rillaboom's damage output, and Pokemon that resist Grass. This includes Entei, Dragonite, and especially Incineroar.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Rillaboom is generally restricted to Fake Out, Wood Hammer, and Grassy Glide, with the 4th move usually being U-turn to pivot and sometimes High Horsepower to check Fire- and Steel-types, that would otherwise completely wall Rillaboom.

  • Rillaboom may run Tera Grass to boost its already high levels of damage, or Tera Fire to stay in on common threats such as Incineroar and Chien-Pao and U-turn out to safely bring in a frailer Pokemon.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to almost always survive Entei's Sacred Fire and avoid the 2HKO from Protosythesis-boosted Flutter Mane's Moonblast while retaliating with a OHKO. Thanks to its priority moves, Rillaboom can afford to not invest in Speed.

Offensive Nuke.description:
• Maximum Attack along with Tera Grass allows Rillaboom to always KO Flutter Mane with Sword of Ruin-boosted Grassy Glide. Protect is favored as the last move, as Rillaboom loses a lot of the bulk from the Assault Vest.

  • This set generally looks for all-or-nothing plays, picking up OHKOs against common tanks such as Iron Hands, Farigiraf, and Ogerpon-W with Wood Hammer, and picking up KOs on frailer pokemon with Grassy Glide.

  • This set can struggle against Intimidate, especially Incineroar, as the sudden drop to its Attack can severely minimize the absurdity of Rillaboom's attacks, allowing bulkier Pokemon to survive a boosted Wood Hammer.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to survive Tera Stellar Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao at -1 and almost always take Fairy Feather Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Rillaboom can afford to forgo Speed investment, as it already outspeeds common slow Pokemon like Farigiraf and Incineroar.

Offensive.description:
Rillaboom's offensive prowess and strong STAB moves, boosted further by Grassy Terrain, make it one of strongest physical attackers in the metagame. Grassy Terrain also plays an important role of overriding other Terrains such as Electric Terrain from Miraidon and Psychic Terrain from Indeedee-F. Grassy Glide is used, since it allows Rillaboom to threaten Pokemon that are faster than it like Urshifu-R. High Horsepower is used to threaten super effective damage on Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Miraidon, and Incineroar. U-turn allows Rillaboom to switch in and out of the battle, helping it reset Grassy Terrain consistently. Protect can be utilized on Miracle Seed variants to block Fake Out as well as stall Trick Room. Choice Band allows Rillaboom to OHKO foes it normally doesn't, while Miracle Seed allows Rillaboom to use Fake Out and means that Rillaboom isn't locked into a single move. The EV spread allows Rillaboom to OHKO Urshifu-R with Miracle Seed Grassy Glide and almost always OHKO Calyrex-I with Choice Band Tera Grass Wood Hammer. In conjunction with Choice Band, Rillaboom can OHKO Miraidon with High Horsepower. The defensive investment allows Rillaboom to survive a Flare Blitz from Incineroar. Tera Grass is used to amplify Rillaboom's damage, while Tera Fire is used defensively to resist Fire- and Ice-type moves like Flare Blitz from Incineroar and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao. Tera Fire can also be used to gain immunity to Will-O-Wisp.

Rillaboom is a great partner to Zamazenta-C, which appreciates its offensive capability to threaten Pokemon like Urshifu-R, Calyrex-S, and Kyogre. Wide Guard support from Zamazenta-C can protect Rillaboom from spread moves like Glacial Lance and Astral Barrage, allowing it to stay on the field longer. Rillaboom pairs well with Chien-Pao, which provides another multiplier to Rillaboom's nuclear damage through Sword of Ruin; in return, Rillaboom helps Chien-Pao by OHKOing Urshifu-R. Urshifu-R and Incineroar are great teammates as well, as the trio forms the Fire / Water / Grass core. Rillaboom has a bad matchup against Incineroar and Tornadus, which resist its moves and threaten it with Flare Blitz and Bleakwind Storm, respectively. Furthermore, Incineroar is a counter to Rillaboom thanks to Intimidate and its ability to threaten Fake Out on Choice Band variants. Chien-Pao is another check, which can survive one attack thanks to Focus Sash and OHKO Rillaboom with Ice Spinner or Icicle Crash.

Hatterene.overview:
• Wielding the highest Special Attack of any Pokemon to get Expanding Force and Speed lower than even Amoonguss, Hatterene is the poster child for Trick Room variants of Psychic-type spam teams. It deals with many of the usual Trick Room answers, including Iron Hands and Amoonguss, even being immune to the latter's Spore due to Magic Bounce. Magic Bounce also prevents potential Taunt users from shutting down Trick Room.

  • Hatterene requires two things to succeed; Trick Room and Psychic Terrain. Indeedee-F provides both with Psychic Surge, Trick Room, and Follow Me to help Hatterene set up its own Trick Room. It is nearly impossible to deny Trick Room against a lead of Hatterene and Indeedee-F. Torkoal and Ursaluna deal with Steel-types that resist both of Hatterene's STAB moves, and they also benefit from Trick Room.

  • Aforementioned Steel-types like Gholdengo are tougher to break through for Hatterene, as well as Dark-types that take neutral damage from Dazzling Gleam, such as Incineroar, Kingambit, and Chi-Yu, the latter of which has Snarl to lower Hatterene's damage output. Assault Vest Raging Bolt running Snarl also slows Hatterene down, despite being weak to Dazzling Gleam. Rillaboom changing the terrain, weakening Expanding Force greatly, and allowing priority moves to go through can also be a huge blow to a gameplan involving Hatterene.

  • Lastly, like most Trick Room sweepers, Hatterene is susceptible to Trick Room either being denied or fully stalled out, leaving it defenseless.

Bulky Life Orb Attacker.description:
• Tera Psychic boosts Hatterene's damage output to scary levels, allowing it to OHKO Ursaluna-B and have a favorable roll to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane. Alternatively, Tera Fire is a great defensive typing against the Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu combination, as well as Gholdengo.
