  • 212 HP EVs minimize Life Orb recoil, and 100 Defense EVs alongside them allow Hatterene to always survive Adamant Tera Dark Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow. The rest of the EVs are invested in Special Attack to maximize damage output, and a Quiet nature + 0 Speed IVs ensures you move before minimum Speed Amoonguss in Trick Room.

Written by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/soulboyvgc.558405/ Quality checked by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/lameliarleo.641287/ Grammar checked by: https://www.smogon.com/forums/members/clouds.356215/

Bulky Support.description:
Indeedee-F's typing, ability, and movepool make it an excellent support Pokemon. Its Normal / Psychic typing allows it to deal with Calyrex-S well, and Psychic Surge has immense utility in Regulation G, as it blocks priority moves like Fake Out from Incineroar and Rillaboom and Prankster Taunt from Tornadus while also denying the Terrains that power up Miraidon and Rillaboom. The combination of Follow Me and Trick Room allows Indeedee-F to threaten either setting up Trick Room itself or redirecting away attacking moves and Taunt to enable a partner to set up Trick Room. Once the dimensions have been twisted, it can use Helping Hand to make a partner Trick Room sweeper even more threatening. Its last move is usually an attacking move to make it less prone to Taunt; Dazzling Gleam pairs well with Tera Fairy and lets it damage both foes, while Psychic gives it a strong Psychic Terrain-boosted STAB move regardless of Tera type. Alluring Voice is an acceptable alternative to Dazzling Gleam, letting Indeedee-F punish setup sweepers like IronPress Zamazenta-C and Nasty Plot Calyrex-S while also bypassing the prominent Wide Guard. The Fairy-type attacks allow Indeedee-F to break Focus Sashes on Dark-types like Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Urshifu so its partner can remove them quickly. However, Psychic allows Indeedee-F to OHKO Urshifu-R. Psychic Seed complements Psychic Surge well, as it reinforces Indeedee-F's special bulk. Safety Goggles allows it to bypass Amoonguss's Rage Powder and redirect away Spore for the benefit of its teammates, while Rocky Helmet lets it damage physical attackers whose contact moves it can redirect; Rocky Helmet can even break a Focus Sash from an Urshifu or Chien-Pao and severely punish Urshifu-R for using Surging Strikes. Tera Fairy allows Indeedee-F to resist the Dark-type attacks that would otherwise threaten it such as Incineroar's Knock Off and Urshifu's Wicked Blow while powering up Fairy-type moves that it may carry. Alternatively, Tera Grass lets it bypass Amoonguss's disruption and become immune to its Spore without having to use Safety Goggles while also granting a resistance to Water- and Electric-type attacks from the likes of Urshifu-R and Miraidon.

With Indeedee-F's utility, it can fit on a variety of teams that appreciate Psychic Terrain, redirection, or its ability to set Trick Room. Calyrex-S appreciates Psychic Terrain blocking priority moves, namely Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch, and powering up its Psychic-type attacks; it is even able to run the devastating Expanding Force with Indeedee-F. Calyrex-S also takes advantage of Indeedee-F's redirection to fire off more of its brutal attacks without fear of retaliation and also benefits from Helping Hand pushing its damage potential up to eleven. Calyrex-I pairs well with Indeedee-F, as it is both a Trick Room setter and a sweeper, meaning that the opponent is hard-pressed to stop either Pokemon from setting up Trick Room with Indeedee-F's support, and once it is set up, Indeedee-F immediately enables Calyrex-I to deal big damage with Helping Hand. Other Trick Room sweepers like Ursaluna, Ursaluna-B, and Torkoal appreciate that Indeedee-F can support them with Helping Hand and Follow Me on top of its ability to set up Trick Room. Indeedee-F is very vulnerable to Dark-types like Urshifu, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar, as the threat of their powerful moves makes it more hesitant to use Follow Me. It also hates Taunt, which completely shuts down all of its utility and thus its field presence. Rillaboom can also interfere with strategies predicated on Psychic Terrain blocking Fake Out.

Offensive.description:
Zacian-C is an excellent setup sweeper in Regulation G, with a fantastic typing and extraordinary Attack and Speed stats. These qualities allow it to take on metagame staples such as Calyrex-I, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane. Play Rough threatens Koraidon and common Steel-resistant foes such as Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Urshifu-R. Sacred Sword can be opted for to 2HKO Incineroar, Ogerpon-H, and Zamazenta-C. Swords Dance allows Zacian-C to OHKO the entire unresisted metagame and boost faster than Incineroar's Intimidate cycling. Alternatively, Substitute can be used to let Zacian-C become immune to Intimidate and Fake Out once it is set up. The EV spread allows Zacian-C to survive Groudon's Precipice Blades and almost always +2 Behemoth Blade from opposing Zacian-C, as well as avoid the 2HKO from Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage. The Attack EVs help Zacian-C 2HKO Groudon, and the Speed enables Zacian-C to outspeed Adamant Chien-Pao. Zacian-C may opt for 164 Speed and 100 Attack with a Jolly nature to outspeed unboosted Iron Bundle while still threatening a 2HKO on Incineroar. Tera Water is Zacian-C's best Tera type, granting a resistance to Fire-type moves like Flare Blitz from Koraidon and Incineroar, while also being a great neutral typing against the metagame. Tera Grass is a good alternative on rain teams, providing Zacian-C with a resistance to Ground-type moves from Groudon and Landorus, as well as a Spore immunity. Both of these give it a crucial resistance to Kyogre's Water Spout. Zacian-C may opt for Tera Stellar to pick up OHKOs on Kyogre and Landorus with Play Rough and Behemoth Blade, respectively.

Zacian-C struggles against Fire- and Steel-types like Ogerpon-H, Entei, and Gholdengo, as they wall its STAB moves and threaten it back. Incineroar especially is an issue, as it easily switches into Behemoth Blade and weakens Zacian-C with Intimidate. This is significant, as it negates Zacian-C's one-time Intrepid Sword boost, and lowers its sweeping potential. This makes Pokemon that can threaten them like Urshifu-R and Landorus fantastic partners. Zacian-C can threaten Raging Bolt and Chien-Pao for Urshifu-R and Landorus. Incineroar, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss are also great partners, providing Zacian-C with free turns thanks to Fake Out, Grassy Terrain recovery, and Rage Powder. Pelipper also pairs well with Zacian-C, providing rain to mitigate its weakness to Fire-type moves like Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel and Incineroar's Flare Blitz. Wide Guard helps greatly against Calyrex-S, Kyogre, and Groudon; Zacian-C, in return, threatens Raging Bolt for Pelipper.

IronPress Sweeper.description:
IronPress Zamazenta-C is one of the most dangerous physical setup sweepers in Regulation G, leveraging its amazing bulk and typing to take over games without being slowed down by Intimidate. Fighting is an excellent offensive type in the current metagame, giving Zamazenta-C a great matchup spread against common Restricted Pokemon like Terapagos, Calyrex-I, Groudon, and Zacian-C; in addition, the popularity of Dark-types like Incineroar, Ting-Lu, and Chien-Pao is great news for it. Heavy Slam is a useful secondary STAB move that importantly covers Flutter Mane and damages other Fighting-resistant Pokemon more than an unboosted Body Press, reducing the amount of team support Zamazenta-C needs to circumvent its checks. Behemoth Bash can be used instead to threaten a 2HKO on Tera Fairy Raging Bolt and a potential 2HKO on Calyrex-I. Wide Guard is an amazing utility option that can be used over Iron Defense or Protect as it protects against deadly spread moves like Astral Barrage and Water Spout, improving the Calyrex-S and Kyogre matchups considerably. 84 Defense EVs with an Impish nature give Body Press enough power to OHKO Miraidon and 2HKO most Fighting-resistant Pokemon after an Iron Defense boost, most notably Landorus and Tornadus, assuming Dauntless Shield is active. The given special bulk investment allows Zamazenta-C to survive Choice Scarf Chi-Yu's Flamethrower and avoid a 2HKO from most Flutter Mane variants. The Speed investment ensures that Zamazenta-C will outrun Adamant Ogerpon formes. Tera Grass is the most consistent Tera type, keeping Zamazenta-C's Fire weakness and worsens its chances against Flying-types like Tornadus; in exchange, it becomes immune to Amoonguss's powder moves and gains a resistance to Ground- and Electric-type attacks, which helps it greatly against Landorus, Miraidon, and Raging Bolt. . Alternatively, Tera Water lets Zamazenta-C shed all of its type weaknesses and giving it key resistances to Fire and Water, the latter of which is especially useful against Kyogre and Urshifu-R.

As a bulky setup sweeper, Zamazenta-C performs at its best when its team is built around damage mitigation and redirection strategies, giving it as many opportunities as possible to set up Iron Defense and fire off its attacks. Rillaboom is an excellent partner that helps Zamazenta-C by providing Fake Out support, recovery from Grassy Terrain, speed control with Grassy Glide, and a useful typing that lets it check Miraidon and Kyogre. Incineroar can make Zamazenta-C even more unbreakable on the physical side with Fake Out and Intimidate, and as a Dark-type, it provides an important check to Calyrex-S. Raging Bolt boasts great offensive and defensive synergy with Zamazenta-C, picking off weakened targets with Thunderclap while helping against Kyogre and Urshifu-R; it can also run an effective Calm Mind set that appreciates the support options that Zamazenta-C wants on its team anyway. Redirectors like Amoonguss and Ogerpon-W give Zamazenta-C even more setup opportunities, and the former can take this a step further by disabling foes with Spore and healing Zamazenta-C with Pollen Puff. Flutter Mane can slow down faster Pokemon with Icy Wind or help break physical tanks with a Choice Specs set; either way, it's great for threatening faster Restricted Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. Ting-Lu can augment Zamazenta-C's special bulk with Vessel of Ruin, check Miraidon and Calyrex-S, and chip foes into Body Press's KO range with Ruination.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
Urshifu-S is used as a generally strong attacker, its Wicked Blow deals massive damage to much of the metagame and ignores Attack drops and Protect, minimizing counterplay. It is a versatile pick on many compositions, as its kit does not need much support and is mainly used to enhance a team's offensive pressure with strong attacks. With Tera Dark, Urshifu-S is capable of OHKOing Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes and Flutter Mane as well as bringing most other targets down to low HP, such as Miraidon and Tornadus. Focus Sash helps Urshifu-S remedy its poor defensive typing, while Sucker Punch is able to somewhat bypass Urshifu-S's middling Speed tier.

Urshifu-S functions well on many teams, but those with strong speed control are where Urshifu-S shines, particularly Trick Room compositions with Calyrex-I, which appreciate the immediate pressure. Trick Room lets Urshifu-S outspeed threats such as Flutter Mane and Zamazenta-C. Additionally, Unseen Fist ignoring Protect means that it is more risky for foes to attempt to stall out Trick Room turns. Urshifu-S struggles against Pokemon that resist Dark, such as opposing Incineroar and Urshifu, as they nullify Urshifu-S's main benefit in dealing big damage with Wicked Blow. While Close Combat is strong, it's less consistent because it doesnt bypass Intimidate and drops Urshifu-S's defenses. Additionally, many of these threats also outspeed and Urshifu-S for super effective damage, such as the Zamazenta-C and Urshifu-R. However, Pokemon like Amoonguss and Incineroar are able to somewhat make up for these weaknesses. Amoonguss provides redirection, resists Fairy and Fighting, and threatens foes with Spore, while Incineroar offers general utility and Fake Out, which foes can't block with Protect at risk of a attack from Urshifu-S. Tera Fairy is also a popular Tera type, used by foes like Raging Bolt and Calyrex-S, which are problematic for Urshifu-S as it cannot break through Tera Fairy users because they resist its STAB combination

Focus Sash.description:
• Close Combat hits common Dark-resistant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit. Sucker Punch provides priority and makes up for Urshifu-S's average Speed tier.

  • Urshifu-S uses Tera Dark to fire off strong Wicked Blows or Tera Stellar to boost the damage output of its STAB moves. Tera-boosted Close Combat OHKOes common Incineroar at -1 Attack, and both Tera types will allow Urshifu-S to OHKO Flutter Mane, provided its boost is still intact for Dark-type moves.

  • Focus Sash allows Urshifu-S to survive any one attack, making up for its poor defensive typing. In contrast to Choice items, it gives Urshifu-S the freedom to switch moves and use Detect when threatened, which is especially strong against Fake Out leads.

  • The extra EVs in Defense are to maximize Urshifu-S's chance of surviving a use of Surging Strikes from Tera Water Mystic Water Urshifu-R.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band is used to guarantee an OHKO on common targets like Landorus, Ogerpon-H, Flutter Mane, and even Tornadus that are not invested heavily in physical bulk. Even naturally bulky Pokemon such as Dragonite and Walking Wake can be OHKOed or put in the range for minimal damage to KO them.

  • Poison Jab is excellent coverage, hitting the problematic Fairy-types that Urshifu-S normally struggles with. After Terastallization, you can guarantee an OHKO on almost all Rillaboom, Terastallized Flutter mane, and even bulkier pokemon like Tera Fairy Indeedee-F. U-turn is also a viable move as a pivot option.

  • The Attack investment and Adamant nature are necessary to get the KOs mentioned earlier, such as the OHKO on Landorus and Tornadus. The Defense investment allows Urshifu-S to survive the combination of Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Sucker Punch from Adamant Chien-Pao. The Special Defense EVs allow Urshifu-S to take a variety of strong attacks such as Earth Power from Landorus and Bleakwind Storm from Tornadus. The remaining EVs are placed in Speed.

  • Tera Poison is chosen to resist the Fighting- and Fairy-type moves that would otherwise hit Urshifu-S super effectively. Urshifu-S is naturally immune to Psychic and has Dark-type moves to cover for the weakness, and it also naturally threatens Psychic-types like Farigiraf. Tera Dark is also an option, as the extra damage combined with Choice Band is absurd and, combined with good Tailwind support and redirection, is a good choice. However, it requires more careful positioning around threats, as Urshifu-S won't be able to Terastallize out of it's Fairy- and Fighting-type weaknesses.

Choice Scarf.description:
Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is an excellent revenge killer and cleaner against many offensive Pokemon. The Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-R outspeed the dangerous Calyrex-S, meaning that the vast majority of offensive teams get naturally outsped and destroyed by its powerful Surging Strikes or Close Combat, and with Unseen Fist, these teams cannot even attempt to outplay it with Protect. U-turn lets Urshifu-R use the threat of its powerful attacks to pivot out, letting its team maintain momentum even when the opponent tries to switch around its attacks while also letting it 2HKO Ogerpon-W. Aqua Jet lets Urshifu-R bypass opposing speed control and priority moves when revenge killing an opposing threat, whereas Coaching makes partner Calyrex-I a significantly bigger threat. Tera Water powers up its Surging Strikes, letting it destroy foes like Calyrex-S. It also lets Urshifu-R shed its weaknesses to Psychic and Fairy, letting it potentially take attacks like Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam and Calyrex-S's Psychic-type moves. This set maximizes both Urshifu-R's Attack and Speed to make it as fast and strong as possible, but an EV spread of 60 HP / 156 Atk / 20 Def / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with an Adamant nature can be also used to survive Rillaboom's Grassy Glide and Mystic Water Kyogre's Water Spout.

Redirectors such as Rage Powder Amoonguss and Follow Me Ogerpon-W disrupt Urshifu-R very effectively, interfering with it attacking vulnerable targets. Rillaboom's Grassy Glide bypasses Urshifu-R's great Speed and threatens it with an OHKO. Miraidon and Raging Bolt both threaten Urshifu-R with their powerful Electro Drift and Thunderclap, respectively. Koraidon, Groudon, and even Tornadus can set up sun, weakening Surging Strikes so that Urshifu-R can be played around more easily. Additionally, a good way to subvert Urshifu-R's great Speed is with opposing speed control. Users include Tailwind Tornadus, Icy Wind Flutter Mane, and Trick Room Calyrex-I or Farigiraf. Urshifu-R's best partner is Tornadus, as it can support Urshifu-R with Tailwind to counter opposing speed control, Rain Dance to boost the power of Urshifu-R's Water-type STAB moves, and Bleakwind Storm to threaten opposing Grass-types like Rillaboom that would threaten Urshifu-R. It can also use Taunt to ensure that Amoonguss cannot use Spore or Rage Powder to disrupt Urshifu-R. Pelipper provides rain with its ability and has a STAB Flying-type attack in Hurricane to threaten Grass-types, and it can use Wide Guard to protect Urshifu-R from the variety of spread moves in the format, including Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and Water Spout from Kyogre. It also can support Urshifu-R with Helping Hand. Amoonguss can handle Electric- and Grass-types that would threaten Urshifu-R by redirecting attacks away from it with Rage Powder. Urshifu-R forms a formidable pivoting core with Rillaboom and Incineroar, with the three spamming U-turn or Parting Shot to stay ahead of the opponent's switches, reactivate Fake Out, cycle Intimidate, and let Urshifu-R choose new moves to lock into. Incineroar helps take on opposing Rillaboom and Amoonguss for Urshifu-R, while Rillaboom deals with Kyogre and opposing Urshifu-R well and slows down Miraidon. Both of them can use Fake Out to prevent one of the opposing Pokemon from attacking, letting Urshifu-R attack the other without interference. Fake Out also often forces foes to use Protect, which Urshifu-R can attack through.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Urshifu-R is an excellent offensive Pokemon that can threaten metagame staples such as Incineroar, Chien-Pao, and Terapagos thanks to its fantastic typing and STAB moves, enabled by Unseen Fist. Taunt is utilized to shut down supportive Pokemon and Trick Room setters such as Amoonguss and Farigiraf as well as prevent Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos and Raging Bolt from setting up. Aqua Jet is a great alternative to get around Raging Bolt's Thunderclap and pick off weakened foes, which is especially useful, as Urshifu-R ignores Protect. Urshifu-R may opt for Swords Dance to become a deadly sweeper, allowing it to OHKO Rillaboom and, after Intimidate, Terapagos-S with Close Combat. Mystic Water boosts Urshifu-R's STAB moves without drawback and allows it to OHKO Incineroar through Sitrus Berry. Safety Goggles lets Urshifu-R ignore Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder, which is significant, as Amoonguss resists Urshifu-R's STAB moves; this also provides opportunities for Urshifu-R to set up. The defensive investment allows Urshifu-R to survive Rillaboom's Miracle Seed-boosted Grassy Glide and almost always survive Raging Bolt's Thunderclap. The Speed EVs allow Urshifu-R to outspeed -1 Flutter Mane and Miraidon. Tera Water sheds Urshifu-R's weaknesses to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, Calyrex-S's Psyshock, and Pelipper's Hurricane, as well as greatly boosting its damage output, allowing it to 2HKO Calyrex-I with Surging Strikes and OHKO Chi-Yu with Aqua Jet once Terastallized. Urshifu-R may use Tera Grass to obtain resistances to Rillaboom and Raging Bolt's priority attacks as well as a Spore and Rage Powder immunity. Tera Ghost can be opted for instead to provide Urshifu-R with a Fake Out immunity, allowing it to keep momentum, and a Fighting immunity that lets Urshifu-R take on Zamazenta-C.

Urshifu-R struggles against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, which take its attacks exceptionally well and threaten it with strong priority STAB moves. Ogerpon-W is also an issue, as it can redirect Surging Strikes and is faster, allowing it to hit Urshifu-R for huge damage with Horn Leech. This makes Tornadus and Amoonguss great partners, as Tornadus can threaten the Grass-types, and Amoonguss can protect Urshifu-R from Raging Bolt with Rage Powder. Tornadus can also provide speed and weather control, making up for Urshifu-R's mediocre Speed tier and handling the otherwise problematic Koraidon, which can significantly weaken Urshifu-R with the sun it sets up. Taunt is another great tool that allows Tornadus to shut down Amoonguss for Urshifu-R. Urshifu-R can take on threats like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu for the two in return. Alternatively, Rillaboom is an excellent pick, as it can pivot in Urshifu-R and threaten Ogerpon-W. Incineroar can pair with Urshifu-R and either Amoonguss or Rillaboom to create a fantastic pivot core, switching in on threats like Rillaboom. Rillaboom and Incineroar also bring Fake Out, which synergises with Unseen Fist. Urshifu-R is also a great asset to Calyrex-S, as it has the ability to remove Ghost-resistant foes like Incineroar and Terapagos.

Glass Cannon.description:
Urshifu-R is one of the strongest physical attackers in the format and can punish defensive plays with its ability Unseen Fist. It has a great matchup into Incineroar, since it ignores Intimidate with its signature move Surging Strikes, can switch into Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I, and is able to deal significant damage to Terapagos with Close Combat. Aqua Jet is almost unstoppable with Unseen Fist and can pick off Pokemon low on HP or deal damage before Urshifu-R gets KOed. Taunt gives it a much better matchup into Amoonguss, shutting it down almost completely, and it prevents Calyrex-I from setting up Trick Room. Focus Sash gives it more survivability and helps with its relatively low Special Defense. Tera Water allows Urshifu-R to deal incredibly high damage with Surging Strikes, allowing for an OHKO against common threats such as Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao through Focus Sash. Tera Stellar lets it OHKO Terapagos-S with Close Combat but loses the consistency of Tera Water, since Urshifu-R can no longer use boosted Surging Strikes repeatedly.

Urshifu-R works incredibly well in Calyrex-S teams, since it can threaten the Normal- and Dark-types that Calyrex-S struggles with, such as Terapagos and Incineroar. In exchange, Calyrex-S can deal with Raging Bolt, which is one of the most common checks to Urshifu-R, as Raging Bolt can use Thunderclap before Urshifu-R can move to bring it down to Focus Sash while also being able to switch-in on Surging Strikes. Urshifu-R synergizes well with Rillaboom and Incineroar, since Fake Out and Unseen Fist are a deadly combination, punishing passive plays such as Protect that try to avoid the flinching turn. Their typings also have incredible synergy with each other, allowing them to switch in on many attacks that Urshifu-R is threatened by. With its great physical bulk and natural type advantage, Rillaboom is a great check to it, slowing Urshifu-R down with Fake Out or doing high damage to it with Wood Hammer or Grassy Glide. Urshifu-R also struggles with Amoonguss, which is able to completely wall it while protecting its teammates with Rage Powder or putting it to sleep with Spore. Tornadus is a good partner for Urshifu-R, helping with its average Speed stat by setting up Tailwind, heavily increasing the damage Urshifu-R does while making the Koraidon matchup easier by using Rain Dance and threatening the Grass-types which could otherwise be problematic such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom with Bleakwind Storm. Koraidon and Miraidon are some of the Restricted Pokemon that have the best matchup into Urshifu-R, as Koraidon is able to set up sun and greatly reduce its damage, while Miraidon is able to outspeed it and bring it down to Focus Sash while also pivoting out with Volt Switch.

Mystic Water.description:
• Aqua Jet picks off weakened Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Entei, which are normally faster than Urshifu-R.

  • The Defense investment helps Urshifu-R take a Choice Band, Tera Normal Dragonite Extreme Speed from maximum Attack Dragonite even with Sword of Ruin active on the battlefield, as well as a Miracle Seed Rillaboom Grassy Glide. The Special Defense EVs let Urshifu-R almost always survive Thunderclap from Raging Bolt and Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs let Urshifu-R outspeed -1 Roaring Moon and Adamant Chien-Pao.

Regidrago.overview:
*Regidrago is a great offensive Pokemon that has immense damage output and can sweep teams easily thanks to Dragon's Maw and Dragon Energy.

*When paired with Pokemon like Tornadus, the Ogerpon formes, and Indeedee that provide speed control, redirection, and priority immunity, respectively, it truly becomes difficult to hinder Regidrago's damage output. Gholdengo is one of its best partners, as it can effectively remove Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, which are major threats for Regidrago.

*Regidrago cannot damage the most influential Pokemon of the format Flutter Manewith its STAB moves. Its middling Speed makes it vulnerable to faster threats, though with the right support that ensures that all the Fairy-, Steel-types, and common Focus Sash users like Chien-Pao are checked, it can absolutely steamroll teams.

Dragon Fang.description:
*Draco Meteor allows Regidrago to pick OHKOs when Dragon Energy isn't dealing much damage at low HP, and Earth Power allows it to damage to Steel types like Gholdengo and Kingambit.

*Regidrago boosts its damage output with Dragon Fang that stacks on Dragon Maw and does insane damage.

*Tera Steel is a great defensive Tera that allows it to resist its original weaknesses.

Bulky Trick Room Sweeper.description:
Calyrex-I utilizes its high bulk and Attack, combined with its spread move Glacial Lance, to be a strong bulky attacker. Calyrex-I can spiral out of control quickly thanks to Chilling Neigh Attack boosts, while its access to Trick Room and low Speed stat allow it to operate as both a Trick Room setter and sweeper. Calyrex-I runs High Horsepower for coverage, letting it hit Fire- and Steel-types that resist Glacial Lance, such as Incineroar and Gholdengo. Calyrex-I runs Clear Amulet for an immunity to Intimidate and Incineroar's Parting Shot. Tera Fire will give it an immunity to Will-O-Wisp and improve its match up into Gholdengo. Tera Water grants Calyrex-I a better match up into both Kyogre and Gholdengo, while Tera Grass provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss along with a stronger match up into Kyogre. The allocated EV spread allows Calyrex-I to survive an Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon, while the allocated Attack allows Calyrex-I to OHKO Rillaboom.

Calyrex-I pairs well with Fake Out users and redirection support, which can allow it to set up Trick Room more easily, such as Incineroar and Amoonguss. Amoonguss is an especially strong partner, as the Grass-types that are immune to Spore are weak to Glacial Lance. Amoonguss can use Spore and Rage Powder against Zamazenta, which can otherwise set up Iron Defense and wall Calyrex-I, and use Spore and offer Pollen Puff recovery against Kyogre, which otherwise has a favourable damage trade against Calyrex-I. Calyrex-I also pairs well with Pelipper, as the rain reduces damage from Fire-type attacks, and it provides Wide Guard support, which can protect it against Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and Kyogre's Water Spout. Non-Tera Grass Calyrex-I will struggle against Amoonguss, as it can underspeed it in Trick Room and use Spore, while non-Tera Fire variants will be vulnerable to Incineroar's Will-O-Wisp.

Offensive.description:
With blazing Special Attack, high Speed, and As One making it even more threatening after picking up a KO with its powerful Astral Barrage, Calyrex-S is the most powerful sweeper in the game. Nasty Plot allows it to take advantage of the opponent playing passively to become unstoppable. Psyshock threatens opposing Calm Mind users such as Terapagos and Raging Bolt. Draining Kiss can also be used to hit Dark-types and provide Calyrex-S with recovery. Expanding Force can be an option when paired with Indeedee-F, as it has more power than Psyshock in general. Nasty Plot is a must on Spell Tag sets but can be eschewed in favor of an attacking move for Life Orb and Choice Specs variants; sometimes, Shadow Ball is used on Choice Specs to get around Wide Guard. Choice Specs maximizes Calyrex-S's power in return for less flexibility, while Life Orb is mainly used on Expanding Force sets in order to increase the damage output of both STAB moves while keeping the flexibility of Protect. Alternatively, Spell Tag gives Calyrex-S a boost to its main STAB moves with no drawbacks. The HP and Defense investment allows Calyrex-S to survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, and maximum Speed investment is run for opposing Calyrex-S, which can be crucial in deciding the game, as they both either OHKO each other with Astral Barrage or force Terastallization. The Special Attack investment allows Calyrex-S to OHKO bulkier Flutter Mane with Spell Tag, allows Life Orb variants to 2HKO Incineroar with Astral Barrage after a boost from Nasty Plot, and ensures that Choice Specs variants almost always OHKO Calyrex-I from full HP. Fairy is the main Tera type for Calyrex-S, as it is neutral into the majority of the metagame and flips the matchup against Urshifu-S while also boosting the power of Draining Kiss. Ghost is an alternative, however, to boost Astral Barrage's power to even more dangerous levels.

Calyrex-S being given an opportunity to set up Nasty Plot can end the game, so Pokemon with Fake Out and redirection support are highly appreciated. Incineroar, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Ogerpon-W are all common partners. Amoonguss also has the benefit of thriving under Trick Room, a matchup which Calyrex-S struggles against, due to its high Speed and frailty being turned against it. Fighting-types such as Mienshao and Urshifu-R are used to deal with Ghost-resistant Pokemon like Incineroar, Terapagos, and Chien-Pao. Speed control is a common way to take advantage of Calyrex-S's frailty, such as using sun to activate Protosynthesis on Flutter Mane, which can OHKO Calyrex-S with Shadow Ball and 2HKO it with Moonblast, regardless of whether Calyrex-S Terastallizes. Therefore, Pokemon that can provide speed control to keep it the fastest Pokemon on the field, like Tornadus, make an excellent fit and have the advantage of also helping in the Calyrex-S mirror matchup. Indeedee-F is a notable partner for Calyrex-S, giving it redirection in Follow Me and Helping Hand support while being able to reverse opposing Trick Room, block threatening priority such as Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S, and turn Expanding Force into a brutal sweeping tool.

Focus Sash.description:
Calyrex-S is the number one threat in the Regulation G metagame, boasting an immensely powerful Astral Barrage off its phenomenal Special Attack and Speed that 2HKOes most of the metagame. Its access to Nasty Plot, shooting up its Special Attack to astronomical levels, in conjunction with its ability to hit most Pokemon for neutral or super effective damage like Rillaboom and Calyrex-I make it a Pokemon that every team needs to be more than adequately prepared for. Calyrex-S's Ghost typing crucially allows it to be immune to Fake Out from the likes of Incineroar and Rillaboom. Psyshock hits specially defensive Pokemon like Calm Mind Terapagos and Raging Bolt and those holding Assault Vest like Rillaboom hard. Psychic can be run instead to guarantee an OHKO on Urshifu-R, since Psyshock is a damage roll to do so. Alternatively, Draining Kiss lets Calyrex-S hit Dark-types such as Urshifu-S while maintaining longevity. Tera Blast can, however, be run over Draining Kiss in conjunction with Tera Fairy for higher power. Focus Sash ensures that Calyrex-S gets at least two attacks off thanks to its high Speed. Tera Ghost boosts Astral Barrage even further, leaving only Incineroar that can survive it at +2. Tera Fairy allows Calyrex-S to easily take Wicked Blow, Sucker Punch, and Knock Off from the likes of Urshifu-S, Chien-Pao, and Incineroar, respectively, while also powering up its own Fairy-type move of choice.

Calyrex-S, though highly oppressive with Astral Barrage alone, faces difficulty wearing down the ubiquitous Incineroar while also being completely unable to hit Terapagos with Astral Barrage. Urshifu-R helps Calyrex-S with this beautifully, threatening both of its mentioned checks and also boasting good matchups against other Dark-types in Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S. Incineroar and Rillaboom are also good allies as they provide Calyrex-S with Fake Out and recovery, letting it set up Nasty Plot more easily. Clefairy and Amoonguss are other good allies, as they redirect attacks away from Calyrex-S, allowing it to fire off Astral Barrage safely. The former also bolsters Calyrex-S's bulk with Friend Guard and can help it almost always move first even under Trick Room, thanks to After You; this is important because Calyrex-S is very vulnerable under the twisted dimensions. Amoonguss can heal it via Pollen Puff.

Ursaluna.overview:
• Ursaluna threatens OHKOs on most Pokemon with its Guts ability and access to a STAB combination that hits the entire metagame for neutral damage. Combined with a sleep immunity once Burned and low natural Speed, Ursaluna is a great Trick Room sweeper.

  • Ursaluna pairs exceptionally well with Trick Room setters like Indeedee-F and especially Cresselia. Indeedee-F supports it with Follow Me and Psychic Terrain, providing Ursaluna with a Fake Out immunity. Cresselia has excellent defensive synergy with Ursaluna and thanks to Levitate is immune to Ursaluna's Earthquake. It can also support Ursaluna with Lunar Blessing and Helping Hand.

  • One of Ursaluna's biggest weaknesses is ironically one of its strengths, Guts. Setting up may put Ursaluna at risk of damage or if using Protect, give up a turn of Trick Room and leave its partner vulnerable to being attacked twice. Since Ursaluna is a physical attacker, it is especially vulnerable to Fake Out and Intimidate cycling. A combination of Incineroar and Amoonguss is especially difficult for Ursaluna to deal with, as they can easily stall out Trick Room by constantly weakening Ursaluna, and Amoonguss also healing Incineroar with Pollen Puff. Ursaluna is also naturally weak to many Fake Out Pokemon, such as Rillaboom and Iron Hands, the former also halving Earthquakes damage thanks to setting up Grassy Terrain.

Guts Attacker.description:
• Facade and Headlong Rush are used as the strongest attacks available to Ursaluna. Earthquake is used as a strong spread damage option and to bypass Follow Me from opposing Ogerpon formes. Swords Dance can also be used to punish passive play and to reverse some of the effects from Intimidate, but this forces Ursaluna to give up one of its Ground-type moves.

  • The EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, all after burn damage. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack

  • Tera Ghost is used to give Ursaluna an immunity to Fighting-type attacks but more importantly Fake Out, removing a key method to stalling out Ursaluna's Trick Room turns. Tera Poison can be used for more resistances, notably improving the matchup against Rillaboom and Flutter Mane, which it normally struggles with; however, Ursaluna loses the Fake Out and Fighting immunity.

TailRoom Sweeper.description:
Ursaluna-B is a special attacking Trick Room sweeper with strong natural bulk and a STAB combination that can hit most Pokemon for neutral damage. With its part-Normal typing and Mind's Eye ability, it has a good matchup into Calyrex-S. It also does well against any Pokemon that cannot handle its STAB combination such as Urshifu-R, which has a high chance of being OHKOed by a Tera Normal Hyper Voice; Gholdengo, which is KOed by Earth Power; and Pokemon such as Ogerpon-H that are OHKOed by Blood Moon. Life Orb gives Ursaluna-B a consistent boost in damage output. Hyper Voice threatens both Pokemon on the opponent's field and helps steamroll games quickly if Ursaluna-B is not handled with. Blood Moon is also an option to hit a single foe for heavy damage. Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 244 Hp / 252 SpA / 12 SpD with a Quiet Nature and 0 Speed IVs to function best under Trick Room and minimize Life Orb recoil. Tera Normal increases Ursaluna-B's offensive pressure greatly, allowing for guaranteed OHKOs on Flutter Mane, Amoonguss, and Incineroar with Blood Moon as well as shedding many of its weaknesses.

Amoonguss counters Ursaluna-B, as it can outspeed Ursaluna-B and hit it with Spore in Trick Room. Ting-Lu can outspeed Ursaluna-B and slow its pace greatly thanks to Vessel of Ruin and Snarl. Farigiraf can prevent opposing Fake Out from stalling out Ursaluna-B, enable Ursaluna-B by setting Trick Room, and further boost Ursaluna-B's damage with Helping Hand. Miraidon prevents opposing Spore from affecting Ursaluna-B with Electric Terrain, and Ursaluna-B synergizes well with it due to its immunity to Discharge.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice provides Ursaluna-B with a more spammable Normal-type STAB attack, especially during Blood Moon's cooldown.

  • Life Orb is recommended, as it provides Ursaluna-B with a boost to its attacks, and Ursaluna-B doesn't mind the recoil due to its great bulk and ability to consistently move first under Trick Room.

  • The given EV spread lets it live a Tera Fairy Moonblast from a Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane. 0 Speed IVs and a Quiet nature allow it to function better under Trick Room.

  • Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 84 HP / 252 SpA / 172 Spe to outspeed Adamant Chien-Pao under Tailwind.

  • Tera Normal can be used to boost the damage output of Blood Moon and Hyper Voice to nuclear levels.

Glimmora.overview:
• Glimmora is a strong offensive threat with access to a good STAB combination and the powerful move Meteor Beam, which, when used with the Power Herb, can melt many targets, such as Assault Vest Entei and Incineroar. With Toxic Debris and signature move Mortal Spin, Glimmora can punish physical attackers and passive play, and, when combined with the threat of Meteor Beam, make it impossible to ignore while also requiring careful positioning to properly handle.

  • Glimmora has traditionally fit best on Dondozo teams, as the combination of Toxic Debris and Mortal Spin means your foes almost guaranteed to be afflicted with poison, putting your opponent on a timer. Assault Vest on Glimmora is especially effective on Dondozo teams, as the extra longevity helps it spread poison better and stall out even longer, making up for the lowered damage output.

  • With Meteor Beam, Glimmora can utilize its high Special Attack stat and good offensive typing as a damage dealer. Tornadus and Ogerpon-W are good partners; Tornadus provides speed control and can launch powerful Bleakwind Storms into Fighting-types that resist Meteor Beam and Ogerpon-W redirects potential Water- or Ground-type attacks while pressuring threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus. In return, Glimmora can threaten Grass-types, which resists both Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

  • Glimmora's poor defensive typing, combined with its middling bulk and average Speed, makes Glimmora a glass cannon. Glimmora is weak to many prominent offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Landorus, and Gholdengo. Glimmora also struggles to handle Rock-resistant foes such as Iron Hands, Kingambit, and Urshifu-R. Even then, many of these foes will concede Toxic Spikes while taking out Glimmora; for instance, Urshifu-R will set up both layers of Toxic Spikes if it attacks Glimmora. Amoonguss is another difficult match up, as it absords Toxic Spikes and takes Glimmora's attacks comfortably, while threatening a Spore.

Meteor Beam.description:
Meteor Beam's power against most neutral targets is devastating. The Special Attack boost allows Glimmora to output offensive pressure with Sludge Bomb even after Power Herb is consumed.

  • Earth Power is used as coverage for the Steel-types that resist Glimmora's STAB combination. Energy Ball is also an option to utilize the Tera Grass STAB boost and to hit Pokemon that resist Meteor Beam such as Urshifu-R but makes it so that Steel-types resist all of Glimmora's attacks.

  • The Special Attack investment along with the Modest nature is necessary to pick up a OHKO on Landorus, Walking Wake, and Terastillized Urshifu-R with Meteor Beam. The OHKO on Landorus and Urshifu turns the match up against hyper offensive teams completely on its head, especially with speed control support from Tornadus.

  • The Defense investment is enough to guarantee surviving Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and a favourable roll of taking Kingambit's Iron Head. The Special Defensive investment lets it live Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Latias's Mist Ball. The rest of the EVs are invested into Speed, which allows Glimmora to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Grass has better synergy with Glimmora's original typing and provides an immunity to spore, but gives Glimmora weakness to common threats such as Chien-Pao. Tera Water, defensively, is a stronger neutral type into the metagame, but has fewer relevant resistances to common threats.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Both Earth Power and Energy Ball are fine options, but Energy Ball can do more damage against neutral targets if Glimmora Terastallizes into a Grass type.

  • Mortal Spin is used as the final move for a more consistent method to spread poison than Toxic Debris.

  • The Assault Vest gives Glimmora much more longevity, as it allows it to comfortably tank special attacks while still dissuading physical attackers with the threat of Toxic Spikes. On teams where being able to spread poison is important, Assault Vest is a good option.

  • The special bulk allows Glimmora to live many strong super effective attacks, such as Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain; it also makes Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball a 3HKO. Glimmora still lives a Rillaboom Wood Hammer with the HP investment.

Dondozo.overview:
• Dondozo is a formidable threat thanks to its stats being doubled when combined with Tatsugiri's Commander ability. Due to its immense bulk, Dondozo is difficult to remove without adequate answers, easily sweeping through entire teams on its own.

  • Dondozo performs best with offensive threats that can break apart teams for it and still function independently without needing to pivot. Examples include Chien-Pao and Dragonite, as well as Tornadus and a sweeper such as Urshifu-S or Flutter Mane. The two cores utilize strong speed control and get off massive damage early, allowing Dondozo to clean up. Glimmora is another excellent partner, as its ability and signature move put foes on a timer, forcing them to burn through Dondozo before fainting to Toxic poison.

  • Dondozo struggles against Pokemon that can ignore its stat boosts, either by neutralizing or bypassing it entirely. Both Urshifu formes and Chien-Pao with Sacred Sword ignore Dondozo's Defense boost, with Chien-Pao both outspeeding and threatening Dondozo if it uses Tera Grass, and Urshifu-S dealing big damage with Wicked Blow and removing Dondozo's ability to stall with Protect. Incineroar and Gouging Fire are able to consistently weaken Dondozo with Breaking Swipe and Intimidate cycling respectively. A combination of Incineroar and Amoonguss is particularly difficult to handle, as Amoonguss can keep Incineroar safe with redirection and Incineroar is free to cycle Parting Shot and Intimidate.

  • Dondozo requires much more experience to properly play compared to other sweepers, due to only making plays with one Pokemon for most of the game. While its not impossible to play into certain difficult matchups, especially with a strong composition and much practice, it necessitates significant reads and good positioning of Dondozo to win.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest Water-type move, OHKOing Pokemon like Tornadus and Gholdengo. Earthquake bypasses Follow Me from Ogerpon-W, and provides it a strong spread move thats picks off weakened foes.

  • Rocky Helmet breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Urshifu, allowing for an OHKO. It also allows for big damage on Urshifu-R using Surging Strikes. Leftovers allows Dondozo to recover swathes of health, even more so by stalling with Protect. However, its harder to use now, as most threats to Dondozo can outdamage Leftovers recovery, especially so considering the Urshifu formes ignore Protect. Clear Amulet can be used to remove ways to weaken Dondozo, primarily Incineroar and Gouging Fire.

  • 20 Defense EVs ensure that Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao is a 4HKO and allow Dondozo to survive two Wicked Blows from Urshifu-S. 76 Special Defense EVs allow Dondozo to survive two Moonblasts from Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Attack investment ensures Wave Crash OHKOes Urshifu-S after Rocky Helmet damage and that Order Up 2HKOes Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks, as well as giving an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss, which is otherwise difficult to deal with.

Supportive Yawn.description:
• Dondozo can utilize its strong natural bulk and typing to function as a supportive wall with Yawn.

  • Yawn Dondozo pairs best with Ting-Lu, as a combination of Sand Tomb and Yawn can reliably slow down foes and Ting-Lu's Vessel of Ruin helps with Dondozo's frailer Special Defense.

  • Dondozo struggles against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, as both resist Wave Crash, and it is harder to make damage over time stick with Grassy Terrain and Pollen Puff respectively. Additionally, the former threatens super effective damage on Dondozo and the latter threatens Spore.

  • Leftovers recovery gives Dondozo additional staying power in slower-paced battles compared to recovery Berries.

  • Oblivious prevents Dondozo from being shut down with Taunt from Pokmon such as Tornadus or affected by Intimidate from foes like Incineroar.

  • The invested bulk allows Dondozo to survive Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt, as well as surviving two Earth Powers from Landorus and OHKOing in return with Wave Crash. Heavy Slam is used to OHKO Flutter Mane.

Tatsugiri.overview: • Tatsugiri is solely used to combine with Dondozo, and shouldn't be picked outside of that purpose.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• Icy Wind is used as a late-game speed control option. Dragon Pulse is a more consistent STAB move compared to Draco Meteor and Muddy Water, at the cost of damage. Sleep Talk allows Tatsugiri to better answer Amoonguss, while Tera Blast hits Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao in the rare circumstances where Tatsugiri is Terastallized.

  • Choice Scarf allows Tatsugiri to clean up late-game once Dondozo is down, either serving as speed control with Icy Wind to support its partner or dealing damage with Muddy Water and Draco Meteor.

  • The given EVs allow Tatsugiri to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T and survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Steel gives Tatsugiri a resistance to Dragon and Fairy and a generally better defensive profile. Tera Water can be used to boost Muddy Water's damage and remove its weakness to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, which is useful in some end-game scenarios.

Bulky Disruption.description:
Farigiraf's main role is as a bulky disruption piece and Trick Room setter, and its ability to block priority is incredibly valuable in a format full of moves like Fake Out, Grassy Glide and Thunderclap. Due to its typing, it has a good matchup into Calyrex-S, as well as Psychic-type STAB moves are generally good into the metagame but especially into Amoonguss and Urshifu-R. Tera Blast is often seen in this slot, as both before and after Terastallization, it gives Farigiraf a consistent single-target STAB move. Foul Play is used to give Farigiraf a way to hit both Calyrex formes for super effective damage, being able to 2HKO both. Electric Seed is used in tandem with Miraidon, and gives Farigiraf more bulk, allowing it to stick around longer to support the team with Helping Hand and Armor Tail. Sitrus Berry allows Farigiraf to disrupt the opponent for longer than it would be able to without it. It can also help live some double-ups to help safely get Trick Room up, such as Surging Strikes + Knock Off from Urshifu-R and Incineroar, respectively. Safety Goggles is for if your team has a particularly bad matchup into Amoonguss and Farigiraf wants to be able to set up Trick Room without being put to sleep without Electric Terrain support from Miraidon. The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to live a Choice Specs Beads of Ruin single target Tera Starstorm from Terapagos, and the rest is put into Defense. Tera Ground is used next to Miraidon to allow it to freely use Discharge, and Tera Fairy allows it to resist the Dark- and Bug-type moves it'd otherwise be weak to like Knock Off and U-turn from Incineroar and Rillaboom, while also resisting Fighting-type attacks and gaining an immunity to Dragon-type moves, like Collision Course and Draco Meteor from Koraidon and Miraidon, respectively.

Farigiraf really doesn't like Restricted Pokemon that can OHKO it and potentially prevent Trick Room, such as Kyogre or Tera Fire Koraidon. It also struggles against fast Taunt users, such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane, due to them being able to prevent Trick Room from going up, and bulky Dark-types like Incineroar, as Farigiraf can't hit them very hard without Tera Ground. Incineroar in particular can force a Tera with Knock Off. Miraidon and Farigiraf are great partners for each other, as Farigiraf stops Miraidon from being interrupted by Fake Out, which is particularly important for the Choice Specs set and Miraidon can activate the Electric Seed, making Farigiraf even bulkier, and as previously mentioned, Farigiraf can even Tera Ground so Miraidon can freely click Discharge next to it while the Electric Terrain makes Farigiraf immune to Amoonguss's Spore. Farigiraf itself benefits from partners that can help it set Trick Room, such as bulky Fake Out users like Incineroar and Rillaboom, as well as redirectors like Amoonguss and the Ogerpon formes. Trick Room sweepers also like having Farigiraf as a partner; for example, Calyrex-I loves the boost from Helping Hand, and so does Ursaluna-B. Another great partner is Iron Hands on the aforementioned Miraidon teams, as Farigiraf enjoys having a Fake Out user as a partner, and its Helping Hand lets Iron Hands do insane levels of damage with Quark Drive.

Bulky Support.description:
• While Psychic and Trick Room are self-explanatory, Dazzling Gleam is a fantastic option to hit Dark-types. Psychic Noise is a good option, as it completely restricts the use of Horn Leech from the Ogerpon formes, and Drain Punch from Iron Hands, which Farigiraf's partners might be weak to; Psychic Noise also stops all Pokemon from healing from Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain. Imprison is used to block opposing Trick Room while also stopping opposing Flutter Mane from using Dazzling Gleam. Protect is just a generally consistent option, allowing Farigiraf to stick around to provide the team with priority blocking for longer.

  • Sitrus Berry is generally preferred, as the extra recovery allows it to live important attack combos such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash into Entei's Sacred Fire; however, Safety Goggles is also a valid option, allowing it to ignore Spore from opposing Amoonguss, a common counter to Trick Room.

  • With Sitrus Berry recovery, Farigiraf can always survive an Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and a Sword of Ruin-boosted Sacred Fire from Entei. The Special Defense investment allows Farigiraf to live an unboosted Overheat from Timid Chi-Yu. The rest of the EVs were put into offense.

  • Fairy is the best Tera type on Farigiraf in this format, allowing it to resist common Dark-type attacks from Urshifu-S and Kingambit. It also allows Farigiraf to deal more substantial chip damage with Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam, allowing it to OHKO Urshifu-S.

Offensive.description:
• Hyper Voice activates Throat Spray to inflict a lot of damage and boost subsequent Psychics. Psyshock deals less damage than Psychic overall, but it allows Farigiraf to hit Flutter Mane and Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom harder.

  • Throat Spray allows Farigiraf to put really good amounts of pressure unlike other Trick Room setters. Life Orb allows for more immediate damage and more pivoting ability, as you wont lose the damage boost when switching out, but provides less damage overall.

  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to survive Tera Fairy Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Tera Normal Helping Hand-boosted Hyper Voice from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, as well as non-Tera Life Orb Blood Moon. The heavy amount of Special Attack investment allows Farigiraf to serve its role as an offensive Pokemon very well, especially after a Throat Spray boost. The Defense investment allows Farigiraf to take Surging Strikes from Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Kingambit.overview:
• Kingambit's strong stat line, good typing, and Defiant allow it to shine as an Intimidate counter and general offensive threat. It can function at any Speed tier thanks to Sucker Punch making up for its low Speed. It is flexible against many match ups thanks to its huge bulk and ability to exert huge amounts of pressure after a Swords Dance.

  • Gouging Fire is a fantastic partner for Kingambit, as it can boost its attack with Howl and keep it up on the field longer by reducing opponent's Attack with Breaking Swipe, with Kingambit shielding it from intimidate in return. Physical attackers such as Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Chien-Pao all appreciate Kingambit warding off Intimidate users, with the former two providing Fake Out and Follow Me support, respectively, helping Kingambit set up a Swords Dance, and the latter boosting its damage with Sword of Ruin.

  • Since Kingambit usually only runs Dark-type attacks, it struggles against Pokemon that resist it, such as the Urshifu formes and Incineroar, the latter of which matches up well against Kingambit even when boosting its Attack thanks to resisting both of its STAB types. It also has problems with Amoonguss, since it can redirect Sucker Punch with rage powder and put it to sleep quite easily, while Kingambit cannot threaten it much in return. Raging Bolt can outspeed it and use Thunderclap to attack before Sucker Punch while taking Kowtow Cleave very well, especially since most sets run Tera Fairy.

Offensive.description:
• Swords Dance significantly raises the pressure Kingambit exerts, allowing it to deal significant damage even against resisted targets. However, Iron Head can be used to cover for Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane.

  • Black Glasses provides extra damage, allowing for an OHKO on Flutter Mane at +1 with Sucker Punch; Safety Goggles, however, gives Kingambit a better match-up against Amoonguss.

  • Tera Dragon is chosen to grant resistances to the Ogerpon formes' STAB attacks and other metagame threats that resist Dark, such as Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Tera Fairy is also a strong option as a neutral typing, and it also allows Kingambit to wall Urshifu-S and other Fighting-types.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The given EV spread allows Kingambit to survive Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Earth Power or an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-H as well as avoid the 3HKO from Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt. The Speed investment allows Kingambit to outspeed Landorus in tailwind.

  • Low Kick allows Kingambit to threaten Dark-Types such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit; however, Tera Blast can also be used to cover for Dark- and Fighting-Types at the cost of needing to Terastallize.

Scream Tail.overview:
• Scream Tail has strong supportive moves such as Encore and Disable, which it can consistently use to disrupt opposing Pokemon thanks to its great natural bulk and Speed.

  • Scream Tail works well alongside Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, as it can punish passive plays and shut down Choice-locked threats such as opposing Flutter Mane and Urshifu-R, locking them into resisted Fairy- and Water-type attacks for Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, respectively.

  • Scream Tail cannot provide any offensive pressure outside Dazzling Gleam and hence is completely reliant on its partners to deal damage. It is also vulnerable to being shut down by moves such as Taunt from Tornadus and Spore from Amoonguss. Scream Tail struggles against Gholdengo, which completely counters Scream Tail by being immune to status moves thanks to Good as Gold.

Support.description:
• Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed most of the metagame and launch fast Encores and Disables.

  • Dazzling Gleam is used to chip low health targets. Disable and Encore are great supportive tools to disrupt foes and can punish passive play.

  • The EV spread allows it to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane Shadow Ball while comfortably taking a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Dark Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Dark is preferred for Prankster Taunt immunity and a Ghost resistance. Alternatively, Tera Grass can be used to provide immunity to powder moves from Amoonguss.

Offensive Speed Control.description:
Flutter Mane is one of the fastest Pokemon in Regulation G, and almost nothing can outspeed it with a Booster Energy equipped, making it an excellent form of speed control thanks to Icy Wind; in addition, its excellent STAB combination gives it useful offensive presence against the many Dark-, Fighting-, and Dragon-types of the metagame, such as Chien-Pao, Ting-Lu, both Urshifu formes, Miraidon, and Koraidon. Two single target STAB moves are the default for the excellent coverage they offer, but Moonblast can be swapped out for Dazzling Gleam if bypassing redirection from the likes of Amoonguss, Indeedee-F, and Ogerpon formes is a priority. One of these attacking options can also be exchanged for Taunt, letting Flutter Mane shut down Amoonguss, deny Trick Room, and frustrate setup sweepers like Calm Mind Terapagos and IronPress Zamazenta-C. Icy Wind provides a form of speed control that benefits a variety of mid- to high-Speed teammates. Thunder Wave provides Flutter Mane with extra speed control that also works against Clear Amulet Pokemon such as Koraidon. The given EV spread allows Flutter Mane to survive incredibly powerful hits like Groudon's Precipice Blades and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu's Overheat; it can also tank a Choice Specs Astral Barrage or Tera Ghost Life Orb Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S after Terastallizing. 100 Special Attack EVs ensure a 2HKO on bulkless Chi-Yu with Moonblast and almost always on Calyrex-I with Shadow Ball. 108 Speed EVs with a Timid nature let Flutter Mane outspeed Iron Valiant, which could otherwise use Icy Wind first and ruin Flutter Mane's role as a speed control Pokemon. Tera Fairy is the default Tera type, since it helps Flutter Mane both offensively and defensively, notably allowing it to OHKO Miraidon and Urshifu-R with Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam, respectively, but Tera Grass can also be useful to help deal with Amoonguss's powder moves and Water-, Ground-, and Electric-type attacks like Surging Strikes from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Precipice Blades from Groudon, and Electro Drift from Miraidon.

Flutter Mane pairs well with many Restricted Pokemon, as its high Speed and Fake Out immunity allows it to almost always move first and use Icy Wind; Terapagos is perhaps the most notable partner, as its Speed is quite poor in a vacuum, but it only needs a single Icy Wind to outpace a major chunk of the metagame. Kyogre is also a good choice because Flutter Mane discourages Koraidon from switching in to change the weather against it. Spread attackers like these as well as Calyrex-S and Groudon also benefit from Flutter Mane threatening common Wide Guard users, such as Mienshao and Iron Valiant. In general, any Pokemon that struggles with Dragon- or Dark-types will benefit from Flutter Mane's offensive presence, including Pokemon such as Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-H, Ogerpon-W, Chi-Yu, Calyrex-S, and Lunala. In addition, offensive Fire-types like Chi-Yu and Ogerpon-H are useful for threatening the Steel-types that Flutter Mane struggles with, such as Zacian-C and Kingambit. Pokemon that offer damage mitigation via Intimidate or some other means, such as Incineroar and Snarl users like Ting-Lu and Raging Bolt, can help Flutter Mane stay on the field significantly longer, giving it more time to fire off its powerful attacks.

Glass Cannon.description:
Flutter Mane is a supportive special attacker that functions well on sun teams. Since Flutter Mane is immune to Fake Out, it can ignore the threat of Fake Out to use Taunt on Pokemon such as Calyrex-I or Amoonguss as well as being able to attack without having to fear the chip damage that the move does. Flutter Mane can use support moves such as Taunt over Shadow Ball to prevent opposing Pokemon like Calyrex-I or Amoonguss from setting Trick Room or using moves like Spore, respectively. When paired with Pokemon that set sun such as Koraidon or Groudon, Flutter Mane can use Protosynthesis to boost its Speed and use Icy Wind as a form of speed control, outspeeding and slowing down Pokemon such as Calyrex-S. Dazzling Gleam gives Flutter Mane a spread option that it can boost with Terastallization. Focus Sash lets Flutter Mane live a hit without needing to invest EVs in bulk. Tera Fairy and Stellar both allow Flutter Mane to OHKO Raging Bolt; Tera Stellar allows Shadow Ball to pick up KOs like those against all opposing Flutter Mane. However, Tera Fairy is more consistent, since it can use Fairy-type STAB moves without worrying about losing the boost.

Choice Scarf Urshifu-R threatens Flutter Mane when paired with Pokemon such as Tornadus or Pelipper that can set rain for it, removing both Flutter Mane's Speed boost and the sun. Assault Vest Rillaboom can take Flutter Mane's attacks, threaten it with Wood Hammer, and finish it off on the subsequent turn with Grassy Glide. Flutter Mane pairs well with Pokemon that can redirect attacks away from it such as Ogerpon and Amoonguss, since this allows it to maintain its Focus Sash and stay on the field longer. In addition to redirecting attacks, Amoonguss matches up well into Urshifu-R. Raging Bolt can remove Pokemon such as Urshifu-R that threaten Flutter Mane while also reliably switching into Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide. Chi-Yu also benefits from Icy Wind speed control and threatens Rillaboom while also boosting Flutter Mane's damage with Beads of Ruin.

Choice Specs.description:
Flutter Mane works well as an offensive threat due to its great offensive typing and Speed, allowing it to outspeed most of the metagame and do notable damage to Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and both Calyrex and Urshifu formes. Shadow Ball and Moonblast are strong STAB moves, and Dazzling Gleam provides strong spread damage. Power Gem provides good coverage for Fire-type Pokemon like Incineroar and Ogerpon-H, Taunt is a good way to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Farigiraf, and Icy Wind is great speed control. Choice Specs increases Flutter Mane's offense even further, as it can OHKO Pokemon such as Assault Vest Raging Bolt. The EV spread allows Flutter Mane to outspeed Chien-Pao, Koraidon, and Miraidon without Speed-boosting natures and live an Ice Spinner from Adamant Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy is great both offensively and defensively, as Flutter Mane could output more damage, resist Dark-type moves from the likes of Chien-Pao and Urshifu, and give Flutter Mane a neutrality to Ghost, allowing it to survive an Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S.

Pokemon that can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane, like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Calyrex-S, and Pokemon that can survive Flutter Mane STAB moves like Amoonguss are good checks to Flutter Mane. Flutter Mane's physical fraility is also a huge weakness, mostly fainting against a plethora of physical moves. Incineroar is a good teammate for Flutter Mane, as Intimidate can help Flutter Mane shore up its poor Defense while also having a resistance against Dark- and Ghost-type moves. Pokemon with the ability to set up the sun like Groudon and Koraidon are also good teammates for Flutter Mane, as it allows Protosynthesis to activate and heighten Flutter Mane's Speed stat.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane is an effective cleaner thanks to Moonblast, which is its strongest STAB move, and Dazzling Gleam, which provides spread damage.

  • Special Attack Booster Energy is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item if it wants to keep Protect. Fairy Feather can be used instead, allowing it to retain its offensive boosts when switching at the cost of damage.

  • The EV spread is built to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and to outspeed Tornadus, with the remaining EVs boosting Flutter Mane's Special Attack

  • Flutter Mane appreciates Tera Fairy to further boost its damage on Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam . This also removes its Ghost weakness and makes it resist Dark-type attacks, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Kingambit.

Speed-Boosting Support.description:
• Flutter Mane requires Icy Wind to accomplish its role as speed control, forcing it to pick between Dazzling Gleam and Moonblast.

  • Speed Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the majority of the metagame.

  • With Booster Energy, Flutter Mane can outspeed opposing Chien-Pao at -1 and Modest Gholdengo in Tailwind. The defensive investment lets it survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Tera Fairy is appreciated to gain more of an offensive presence and helps against opposing Flutter Mane, as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is unable to OHKO opposing Flutter Mane with Shadow Ball.

Iron Bundle.overview:
• Iron bundle is the fastest threat in Regulation F thanks to Booster Energy and is used as a speed control option. It can threaten Landorus, Ogerpon-W, Incineroar, and Urshifu-R with super effective damage and an OHKO on the former two.

  • Iron Bundle appreciates offensive Pokemon that take advantage of Icy Wind like Urshifu-S, Ogerpon-H, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Landorus. Flutter Mane and Landorus specifically threaten Kingambit and Urshifu for Iron Bundle.

  • Iron Bundle is weak to priority attackers like Rillaboom, Chien-Pao, Dragonite, and Raging Bolt, since they can ignore Iron Bundle's Speed and Icy Wind's Speed drops while still pressuring it for huge damage if not an OHKO because of its low defenses.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Icy Wind is used for speed control, Hydro Pump is used as the main Water-STAB move, and Freeze-Dry is preferred to threaten common Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • Booster Energy is used to raise its Speed, which allows it to outspeed threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Booster Energy Flutter Mane, and Regidrago and Modest Landorus under Tailwind.

  • Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to threatening priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Iron Hands.overview:
• Iron Hands is a strong Pokemon with high HP and Defense stats that allow it to be an effective switch-in to most neutral attacks, and it also has access to a powerful tool in Fake Out. Iron Hands's great stats allow it to output consistent pressure as well as making it hard to remove. Iron Hands has strong matchups into both Urshifu formes and Tornadus, and its great stats allow it to beat most of the metagame one-on-one.

  • Iron Hands appreciates speed control, so some good partners for it are Farigiraf and Tornadus. The combination of Armor Tail and Trick Room from Farigiraf and Fake Out from Iron Hands almost guarantees Trick Room is set up, which allows Iron Hands to dish out massive damage with Close Combat and Wild Charge. Tornadus is another good form of speed control for Iron Hands, since it can catch opponents off guard and synergizes better with faster offensive partners like the Urshifu formes and Ogerpon-H becauase their high Speed stats do not allow them to function in Trick Room effectively.

  • Iron Hands is weak to Pokemon that help mitigate damage like Incineroar and Landorus-T, since they can cycle Intimidate. This is a huge detriment for Iron Hands, since it is a Pokemon that likes staying on the field and whittle down its foes. Lowering its Attack stat does not allow it to do its job nearly as well. Iron Hands also has to make a very difficult choice in its held item. Clear Amulet leaves it susceptible to special attackers like Landorus and Flutter Mane, while Assault Vest leaves it susceptible to the aforementioned Incineroar and Landorus-T.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Close Combat is picked to allow an OHKO on Incineroar, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage against Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • Clear Amulet prevents stat drops from Incineroar, allowing Iron Hands to play more offensively.

  • The Invested bulk allows Iron Hands to survive a Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, as well as two Icicle Crashes from Chien-Pao. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist attacks from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Drain Punch is used, as Assault Vest Iron Hands wants to keep staying on the field, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-Type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage for Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • The 252 Special Defense EVs are used to minimize the damage taken from threatening special attacks like Earth Power from Landorus or Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs are used to outspeed the Urshifu formes and Adamant Ogerpon formes in Tailwind.

  • Assault Vest helps Iron Hands's low Special bulk and allows it to take super effective hits better.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist moves from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Iron Jugulis.overview:
• Iron Jugulis's great type combination and access to strong support moves such as Tailwind and Snarl make it a niche but powerful disruptive threat. With Booster Energy, Iron Jugulis is able to outspeed almost every other Pokemon in the format and use its great support options to apply pressure on the opponent with fast Snarls and Air Slashes. Its typing gives it an immunity to Prankster Taunt, as well as resistances to attacks from several common threats such as Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow.

  • Iron Jugulis is used on semi-Trick Room teams with Farigiraf and Ursaluna-B, as it forces opponents to respect both a potential Tailwind from Iron Jugulis and Trick Room from Farigiraf. Both Incineroar and Ogerpon-W are great partners for Iron Jugulis; Incineroar provides Fake Out support and weakens potential threats such as Chien-Pao with Intimidate, and Ogerpon-W provides redirection to allow Iron Jugulis to set up Tailwind more easily. Flutter Mane also forms a very strong and consistent pairing with Iron Jugulis, countering opposing Dark-types that Iron Jugulis would have trouble dealing with.

  • While having a few strong resistances, Iron Jugulis's typing also means it's weak to common metagame threats such as Flutter Mane, especially the Speed Booster Energy variants, and Chien-Pao, which threaten an OHKO. Iron Jugulis also struggles against Pokemon that resist its STAB moves and can take advantage of its low damage output like Incineroar and Raging Bolt. Additionally, Iron Jugulis struggles to find a place on most teams due to it competing with Tornadus, which, unlike Iron Jugulis, has access to Prankster Tailwind, a strong Flying-type STAB move in the form of Bleakwind Storm, and Prankster Rain Dance and Sunny Day.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Snarl is helpful to slow down the plethora of strong special attackers in the format.

  • Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to fire off fast attacks like Snarl into opposing special attackers and set up Tailwind more easily, as well as outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao.

  • The bulk allows Iron Jugulis to survive a Extreme Speed from Choice Band Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active, as well as an Icicle Crash from a -1 Attack Chien-Pao. After a Snarl, Iron Jugulis lives a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, as well as Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt.

  • Both Tera Poison and Steel are viable, but Poison is generally preferred thanks to the Fighting resistance and generally better synergy with Iron Jugulis's original type. In comparison, Tera Steel gives more resistances to powerful moves in the format like Blood Moon and Make It Rain, but it is weak to more types than Tera Poison.

Baxcalibur.overview:
• Baxcalibur's massive Attack stat, solid bulk, and STAB Ice-type moves allow it to apply immediate offensive pressure or set up to sweep. Landorus, Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss fear its Ice-type STAB moves, and Incineroar and Ogerpon-W struggle to damage Baxcalibur, which opens up setup opportunities.

  • Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Amoonguss are great teammates for Baxcalibur, providing Intimidate, Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and redirection support to give it opportunities to set up Swords Dance and fire off its attacks. Baxcalibur also functions well on Pelipper + Archaludon rain teams, as it threatens Raging Bolt, Amoonguss, Landorus, and Rillaboom, all of which rain struggles against.

  • Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo resist Baxcalibur's STAB attacks, which can hinder its ability to sweep or punch holes. In addition, the prevalence of Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Urshifu-S can pressure it to Terastallize. Baxcalibur's low Speed can also make it struggle to keep up with offensive pressure from the opposing side.

Clear Amulet.description:
• With the given EV spread, Baxcalibur can outspeed -1 Landorus and survive Choice Band Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S, a Tera Stellar Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao, and a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Glaive Rush is Baxcalibur's best Dragon-type STAB because of its massive Base Power, with Protect offsetting the drawback. Ice Shard makes up for Baxcalibur's middling Speed tier and threatens Landorus. Icicle Crash is a good Ice-type STAB that has a chance to flinch the target. Swords Dance grants Baxcalibur a boosting move that makes it a more threatening Pokemon to the opposition.

  • Tera Poison grants Baxcalibur a to resistance Urshifu's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Fairy-type moves while also being a great neutral type against the majority of the metagame.

  • Clear Amulet gives Baxcalibur an immunity to Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar and Hisuian-Arcanine. It also helps against Icy Wind from Flutter Mane and ElectroWeb from Assault Vest Raging Bolt.

  • Thermal Exchange prevents Baxcalibur from being burned by Wil-O-Wisp users like Incineroar in addition to deterring Ogerpon-H and Chi-Yu from using their Fire-type STAB moves.

Nasty Plot.description:
Nasty Plot Gholdengo is an amazing setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive typing, Make It Rain, and Good as Gold, which gives it an invaluable immunity to Spore from Amoonguss and Taunt. Gholdengo has good matchups into common Restricted Pokemon such as Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C. Nasty Plot is used to allow Gholdengo to set up and sweep opposing teams. Leftovers gives Gholdengo more longevity, while Metal Coat is used so it can OHKO Flutter Mane with unboosted Make It Rain. The Special Attack investment allows Gholdengo to always 2HKO Zamazenta-C with +2 Shadow Ball, while the defensive investment allows Gholdengo to survive Origin Pulse from Mystic Water Kyogre and Flare Blitz from Incineroar. The Speed investment allows Gholdengo to outspeed Pelipper. Tera Normal is used to give Gholdengo an immunity to threatening Ghost-type moves such as Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane, while Tera Water is used because it is a good defensive typing overall while allowing Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks.

Common checks to Gholdengo consist of Incineroar, Chi-Yu, Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and Calyrex-S. Chi-Yu and Calyrex-S outspeed and threaten to OHKO Gholdengo. Assault Vest Raging Bolt easily shrugs off attacks from Gholdengo, while Incineroar walls it and can hit back with super effective Knock Off and Flare Blitz. Common partners for Gholdengo are Amoonguss, Incineroar, Pelipper, Urshifu-R, and Calyrex-I. Amoonguss and Incineroar help Gholdengo defensively by aiding in its setup, with redirection and Pollen Puff healing as well as Fake Out and Intimidate, respectively. On the other hand, Urshifu-R and Pelipper can deal with Calyrex-S, Chi-Yu, and Incineroar thanks to Pelipper's access to the combination of Drizzle and Weather Ball and Urshifu-R's ability to outspeed and OHKO all three of them with Surging Strikes. Calyrex-I is a common Gholdengo partner, since Gholdengo can help deal with threats to Calyrex-I such as Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C.

Choice Specs.description:
Gholdengo is a strong special attacker that uses its great ability to switch into moves like Amoonguss's Spore and Incineroar's Parting Shot, allowing it to attack without being slowed down. Gholdengo is also used as a check to Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, since it walls them. Trick is used to cripple support and setup Pokemon like Amoonguss and Terapagos or force Pokemon that set Trick Room such as Calyrex-I to switch out. Nasty Plot gives Gholdengo the option to set up once it has used Trick. Power Gem hits Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar, Chi-Yu, and Ogerpon-H. Alternatively, Dazzling Gleam threatens Pokemon like Miraidon and Koraidon. Choice Specs allows Gholdengo to use its strong Steel- and Ghost-type attacks to immediately threaten Pokemon like Calyrex-I, especially if it uses Tera Steel. The EV spread allows Gholdengo to survive Choice Specs Miraidon's Volt Switch, Incineroar's Flare Blitz, and Kyogre's Mystic Water-boosted Origin Pulse and OHKO bulky Flutter Mane sets with Shadow Ball.
