The Speed EVs let it outspeed the Ogerpon formes when they are at -1. Tera Steel lets Gholdengo OHKO Landorus and Tera Fairy Assault Vest Raging Bolt, and if Gholdengo is paired with speed control providers such as Tailwind Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, it can run it to boost Make It Rain even further. Tera Dragon allows Gholdengo to resist Fire-type attacks such as Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Groudon's Heat Crash as well as Miraidon's Electro Drift and Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. Tera Water also lets Gholdengo resist Fire- and Water-type attacks like Kyogre's Water Spout and Koraidon's Flare Blitz while not making it weak to Ice- and Fairy-type attacks such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Incineroar resists Gholdengo's STAB combination while threatening it with Flare Blitz and Knock Off. Chi-Yu similarly checks Gholdengo while also outspeeding and threatening an OHKO on it with Dark Pulse or Overheat. Assault Vest Raging Bolt resists Make It Rain and avoids the 2HKO from Shadow Ball. As for teammates, Gholdengo pairs well with Terapagos, since Gholdengo walls Zamazenta-C, while Terapagos matches up well against Calyrex-S and can switch into Ghost-type attacks. Gholdengo also pairs well with Calyrex-I, since it can check Zamazenta-C and Zacian-C, which Calyrex-I struggles with. Gholdengo additionally has great synergy with Pelipper due to rain reducing Gholdengo's weakness to Fire and Pelipper threatening Fire-types that resist Make It Rain such as Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Finally, Chien-Pao and Calyrex-I are both good partners for Gholdengo, since they can threaten Raging Bolt.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chien-Pao is a fast physical attacker that uses its good Speed tier and strong STAB attacks to threaten popular Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S. Ice Spinner is used as a consistent Ice-type STAB move that can remove Terrains that Pokemon like Indeedee-F, Miraidon, and Rillaboom set up. Removing Psychic Terrain can allow Chien-Pao to threaten Calyrex-S with a super effective Sucker Punch. Alternatively, Icicle Crash hits less consistently, but it avoids Rocky Helmet damage, can cause foes to flinch, and keeps up Terrains that would benefit Chien-Pao. Sucker Punch gives Chien-Pao a priority option that can KO faster Pokemon such as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to hit Pokemon that resist its STAB moves like Incineroar and Zamazenta-C. Chien-Pao can run Throat Chop as a consistent Dark-type STAB attack that can hit Lunala and Calyrex-S even if they didn't use an attacking move. Throat Chop also prevents Incineroar from using Parting Shot. Focus Sash allows Chien-Pao to survive at least one attack and to give it the opportunity to use another move due to its high Speed. Chien-Pao can use Tera Ghost to become immune to Fighting while also avoiding priority attacks like Fake Out and Extreme Speed that would otherwise break its Focus Sash. Tera Stellar is a more offensive option that allows Chien-Pao to pick up KOs that it would otherwise miss out on like bulky Flutter Mane.

Chien-Pao pairs well with physical attackers like Zacian-C and Urshifu-R, since they can take advantage of Sword of Ruin to increase their damage. In addition, Urshifu-R can remove Pokemon that resist both of Chien-Pao's STAB moves like Incineroar, while Chien-Pao can threaten Grass- and Dragon-types that resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes like Rillaboom and Raging Bolt. The best check for Chien-Pao is Incineroar, which can lower its Attack with Intimidate as well as resist both its STAB moves. Zacian-C also resists Chien-Pao's STAB moves and threatens it with all of its attacks.

Ting-Lu.overview:
• With excellent bulk, Vessel of Ruin, and a strong support movepool, Ting-Lu makes for a good supportive attacker. Thanks to Vessel of Ruin, it can slow down the metagame's special attacking compositions, like Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B and Flutter Mane + Chi-Yu. These traits make for a good supportive attacker and defensive wall.

  • Ting-Lu synergizes well with bulky disruptive Pokemon that can take advantage of Vessel of Ruin. Dondozo is the perfect example, as it appreciates Vessel of Ruin to more easily set up Yawns in combination with Ting Lu's Sand Tomb. Ting Lu's typing makes it weak to many of the strong physical attackers in the format, such as both Urshifu formes, Rillaboom, and the various Ogerpon formes, meaning it appreciates Incineroar's Intimidate and Amoonguss's redirection.

  • Ting Lu struggles with passivity; it's vulnerable to being overwhelmed or weakened by Intimidate easily, relying on partners to make up for its low damage. These partners can include Dragonite, which is unaffected by Intimidate and threatens big damage with priority, or Gouging Fire, which can use Howl to increase Ting Lu's offensive presence.

Sand Tomb Support.description:
• Sand Tomb is able to trap in opponents so they can't escape disruption like Yawn. Ruination and Rocky Helmet act as the main damage dealing methods, with Stomping Tantrum used as its STAB move and Body Press as a consistent source of damage when Intimidated. Taunt can be used to shut down Amoonguss and other status moves.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to live Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane. The Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane, while Ruination and Body Press provide consistent damage. Alternatively, Throat Chop can be used as a reliable Dark-Type STAB move that can also prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar and Hyper Voice from Ursaluna-B.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk. The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive 3 Moonblasts from Flutter Mane, and it also almost always lives Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Glass Cannon.description:
Chi-Yu is an incredibly strong special attacker, and because of its ability Beads of Ruin, it's able to support other special attacking teammates while still dealing a lot of damage. It matches up well against some common restricted Pokemon such as both Calyrex formes and Zamazenta-C and it can also pressure common Pokemon such as Rillaboom, Gholdengo, and Amoonguss with its STAB moves. Snarl keeps special attacking threats such as Calyrex-S and Terapagos in check and still does respectable spread damage, while Dark Pulse provides strong and consistent damage. Overheat is an instant burst of damage that allows Chi-Yu to OHKO even bulky threats like Rillaboom and Zamazenta-C while also getting around Wide Guard. Since it is very frail, Focus Sash helps Chi-Yu survive for longer, whereas Life Orb gives it a significant damage boost, allowing it to OHKO Flutter Mane with Overheat and 2HKO Miraidon with Dark Pulse. Tera Ghost allows it to avoid Fake Out and gain an immunity to otherwise threatening Fighting-type attacks from Koraidon and the Urshifu formes.

Chi-Yu pairs well with strong special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Terapagos, since both of them benefit a lot from Beads of Ruin. Chi-Yu struggles with its average Speed stat and appreciates speed control from Tornadus, since it allows Chi-Yu to outspeed threats such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Calyrex-S and deal respectable amount of damage with Beads of Ruin-boosted Bleakwind Storm. Chi-Yu also has problems with Urshifu-R, since it can switch-in on both Heat Wave and Dark Pulse and OHKO Chi-Yu back with Surging Strikes. Amoonguss helps with that issue, by redirecting away Fighting- and Water-type attacks from Urshifu-R, letting Chi-Yu deal damage more consistently. Pelipper is a strong Chi-Yu answer, since it sets up rain and is able to protect teammates from Chi-Yu's attacks with Wide Guard. Incineroar and Assault Vest Raging Bolt can take hits from it easily, meaning that the former can pivot out with Parting Shot and the latter is able to use Snarl, do high damage to it, or take advantage of Beads of Ruin and attack its partner.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
Chi-Yu is a phenomenal glass cannon; it has a strong offensive typing and good Special Attack, aided by its ability. These qualities along with proper speed control allow it to pressure common metagame Pokemon including both Calyrex formes, Rillaboom, Amoonguss, and Zamazenta-C. Snarl threatens a common Restricted core that revolves around redirectionCalyrex and Clefairyand it can be used to chip away and weaken the damage output of bulkier specially offensive threats like Raging Bolt and Terapagos. On the other hand, Tera Blast is tailored to the Choice Scarf set, which commonly runs Tera Ground to threaten large amounts of damage to Miraidon, Raging Bolt, and Incineroar. Choice Specs allows Chi-Yu to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Assault Vest Rillaboom and Calyrex-I with Heat Wave and bulky Pelipper with Dark Pulse. Choice Scarf enables Chi-Yu to outspeed common fast metagame staples such as Chien-Pao, Calyrex-S, and Flutter Mane without Protosynthesis Speed activated. The defensive investment guarantees that Chi-Yu survives Surging Strikes and Tera Water Aqua Jet from Urshifu-R when Chi-Yu has used Tera Ghost, High Horsepower from most Assault Vest Rillaboom, and Tera Starstorm from Terapagos-S at +2. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed maximum Speed Adamant Urshifu formes, and it also outspeeds Caylrex-S if running Choice Scarf. Special Attack EVs allow Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to threaten OHKOs on Miraidon with Tera Blast Ground and Ogerpon-H with Overheat. Tera Ghost is absolutely necessary for Choice Specs Chi-Yu because it can avoid Fake Out and Fighting-type moves like Body Press from Zamazenta-C. However, Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is often able to run Tera Ground instead for Tera Blast to pressure certain Pokemon like Miraidon and Raging Bolt.

Incineroar completely walls Chi-Yu and is able to pivot in and out with Parting Shot, while Urshifu-R is able to simply tank a hit and OHKO Chi-Yu. Kyogre and Pelipper are also definite Chi-Yu answers, as they weaken its Fire-type moves with Drizzle and can retaliate with an OHKO with Water Spout or Origin Pulse and Weather Ball, respectively. Chi-Yu has a plethora of great partners; Choice Specs Terapagos and Miraidon both take great advantage of the power boost provided by Beads of Ruin and are able to pressure Pokemon like Kyogre and Incineroar. Koraidon is another good partner for it because it sets up the sun, overriding rain from Pelipper and Kyogre and boosting Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks. This also mitigates its weakness to Water-type moves, aiding in Chi-Yu's matchup against the aforementioned threats. Chi-Yu can also function by itself with speed control from Prankster Tailwind setters like Whimsicott and Tornadus, which can also set up the sun.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Snarl is used as utility and a way to check special attacking compositions such as Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B. Overheat is appreciated as a single target nuke, hitting almost twice as hard as Heat Wave.

  • Choice Specs is used to give Chi-Yu maximum offensive pressure and allow it to pick up OHKOes on Amoonguss and Kingambit with Heat Wave. Alternatively, Chi-Yu can opt for Choice Scarf to outspeed threats like Landorus, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane.

  • The HP EVs allow for Chi-Yu to avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast and once Terastallized into the Ghost-type, almost always survive -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed the Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Chi-Yu prefers Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and be immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial to preserve momentum. Although Chi-Yu can utilize Tera Fire to significantly increase its damage output, allowing Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to OHKO Ogerpon-W and Flutter Mane with Overheat and Choice Specs variants to remove Assault Vest Kingambit and Rillaboom with Heat Wave.

Roaring Moon.overview:
• Roaring Moon provides a niche as either a fast speed control option or setup sweeper thanks to the Prankster immunity provided by its Dark typing and access to Attack and Speed Booster Energy, further bolstered by its superb movepool. Roaring Moon's Dark-type STAB moves and excellent elemental resistances make it a great answer to Iron Crown and Gholdengo, as well as the Ogerpon formes.

  • Roaring Moon appreciates partners such as Ogerpon-W, Amoonguss, and Incineroar, which help it to set up Tailwind or Dragon Dance through free turns, the former two handle threats like Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane exceptionally well. Ogerpon-W greatly benefits from Tailwind, while Amoonguss has superb defensive synergy with Roaring Moon; all partners enjoy Breaking Swipe as well. With Acrobatics, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon can help the former two by removing the powder-immune Grass-types and help Incineroar by threatening both Urshfiu formes. Flutter Mane is also a great beneficiary of Roaring Moon, handling opposing Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes with Tailwind support, and Breaking Swipe protecting it from the physical attackers it's weak to.

  • Roaring Moon's typing, while welcoming fantastic resistances, also invites weaknesses to some of the metagame's most popular threats like the aforementioned Flutter Mane, both Urshifu formes, and Chien-Pao. Roaring Moon can notably mitigate the latter two's damage output if running Breaking Swipe and break Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao's Focus Sash in the process but requires support against them. Incineroar also poses an issue for Roaring Moon, as it resists Knock Off and weakens Roaring Moon with Intimidate. Incineroar's Fake Out can also be used to stall Tailwind turns.

Dragon Dance Sweeper.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Roaring Moon to be an effective sweeper and helps reset Intimidate Attack drops, making it harder to slow down.

  • Roaring Moon utilizes Attack Booster Energy to activate Acrobatics, allowing for an OHKO on many centralizing Fighting- and Grass-types, such as the various Urshifu and Ogerpon formes, as well as Amoonguss after Terastalization.

  • After Terastalization, the bulk investment allows Roaring Moon to always survive a Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and a Thunderclap from a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Flying to obtain a resistance to Fighting-type moves and to gain STAB on Acrobatics.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Roaring Moon utilizes Breaking Swipe to weaken the metagame's plethora of physical attackers such as the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom.

  • Roaring Moon uses Speed Booster Energy to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and get off Tailwind and Breaking Swipe more consistently.

  • The HP combined with the Defense EVs allow for Roaring Moon to take Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash at -1. The Special Defense EVs allow Roaring Moon to almost always survive unboosted Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam, as well as a Dragon Pulse from Raging Bolt. The Speed investment lets Roaring Moon outspeed Speed Booster Energy Iron Crown, as well as Adamant Dragonite under Tailwind,

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Poison to obtain resistances to Fairy- and Fighting-type moves it was originally weak to, which is also a great neutral typing into the metagame.

Clear Amulet.description:
Koraidon is a powerful offensive threat that can also enable its partners with sun. Koraidon's strong attacking moves and high base Attack in the sun allow it to beat many metagame staples such as Amoonguss, Rillaboom, Urshifu-R, and Terapagos. Collision Course is Koraidon's preferred STAB move thanks to a lack of drawbacks, and Flare Blitz is Koraidon's strongest move due to sun. Flame Charge will make Koraidon the fastest Pokemon on the field after its use. Clear Amulet is the item of choice to prevent stat drops from Incineroar and Icy Wind Flutter Mane. The EV spread allows Koraidon to survive an Adamant Chien-Pao Ice Spinner and Helping Hand-boosted Astral Barrage from Spell Tag Calyrex-S. Tera Fire is used to increase the power of Flare Blitz and Flame Charge while offering a resistance to Fairy- and Ice-type moves such as Moonblast and Ice Spinner from Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, respectively.

Calyrex-I is a good check to Koraidon, since it can Terastallize into Fire or Water to resist Flare Blitz, set up Trick Room, and deal super effective damage to Koraidon both before and after its Terastallization with Glacial Lance and High Horsepower, respectively. Pelipper and Tornadus completely counter Koraidon, dealing massive damage with their Flying-type moves and being able to shut down sun with their weather control. Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt offer strong damage in the sun; Flutter Mane provides speed control with Icy Wind, and Raging Bolt offers a check to Pokemon that can change the weather like Pelipper, Tornadus, and Kyogre. Incineroar and Rillaboom are used since they have access to Fake Out, allowing Koraidon to attack freely.

Choice Specs.description:
Miraidon is able to sweep through teams thanks to its high Special Attack and Hadron Engine setting up Electric Terrain, which increases its damage output and prevents sleep such as from Amoonguss's Spore. Miraidon runs Choice Specs and Tera Electric to increase its damage output further allowing it to OHKO bulky Pokemon, such as Incineroar. Volt Switch allows Miraidon to pivot out, which, when combined with its high Speed, allows it to avoid damage trades and help it win the Terrain war against Rillaboom. Draco Meteor is run as STAB coverage, as its high base power allows it to OHKO threats like Groudon, Koraidon, and Raging Bolt. Miraidon can use Discharge to circumvent redirection, such as Amoonguss's Rage Powder or Ogerpon-W's Follow Me; however, this can force Miraidon's ally to use Protect unless it is a Ground-type. Miraidon has a strong matchup into Kyogre, as it can outspeed and threaten to OHKO it.

Miraidon is often paired with Farigiraf because it blocks Fake Out, which Miraidon cannot block and slows Miraidon down easily. Miraidon is also usually paired alongside Whimsicott for Tailwind support, which allows Miraidon to outspeed and OHKO Calyrex-S. Miraidon also struggles against foes that can maintain speed control, such as Calyrex-S in Tailwind and Calyrex-I in Trick Room, as they can outspeed Miraidon and threaten big damage. Calyrex-S often runs Focus Sash to take a hit from Miraidon, while Calyrex-I OHKOes Miraidon with Glacial Lance. It can also struggle against Groudon with redirection support, as Draco Meteor can be redirected and Precipice Blades threatens to OHKO in return. Miraidon should also carefully maintain Electric Terrain against Rillaboom in order to not have its damage output significantly reduced.

Walking Wake.overview:
• With an excellent typing and respectable stats, Walking Wake finds a place on sun teams using Protosynthesis to make up for its Speed tier while also 2HKOing most neutral targets with sun= boosted Hydro Steam and threatening common Pokemon like Incineroar and Landorus.

  • Walking Wake pairs well with Torkoal, which can set up sun and support it through moves like Helping Hand. It is commonly sighted with Ogerpon-C, which provides redirection, and Farigiraf, which blocks priority.

  • Walking Wake struggles against a common threat, Flutter Mane which threatens it with its Fairy-type STAB moves and outspeeds it. Ogerpon-W also has a good matchup, since it can redirect Hydro Steam and threaten a 2HKO on Walking Wake with Horn Leech. It also consistently needs sun up, which can be advantageous to opposing Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt, as they can then threaten an OHKO on it.

Sun Sweeper.description:
• The EV spread allows Walking Wake to survive Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam and Adamant Miracle Seed Rillaboom's Wood Hammer. It can also pick an OHKO on Amoonguss with Life Orb-boosted Flamethrower in sun.

  • Hydro Steam and Draco Meteor are Walking Wake's main STAB moves, while Flamethrower can threaten Pokemon that resist them, like Amoonguss and Kingambit. Dragon Pulse is a more spammable STAB move thanks to lack of drawbacks. Tera Blast can provide additional coverage when utilised with Tera Steel, threatening massive damage on Fairy-types like Flutter Mane.

  • Tera Fire and Steel are preferred to gain a resistance to Flutter Mane's and Rillaboom's STAB moves. Tera Fire also resists Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and boosts Flamethrower, which can threaten huge damage combined with the sun boost. On the other hand, Tera Steel grants crucial resistances, such as against Raging Bolt's Dragon-type STAB attacks, which normally threatens Walking Wake.

Ogerpon.overview:
• Ogerpon is a strong offensive Pokemon that is unique in being able to check many top Pokemon such as Incineroar and Flutter Mane thanks to its ability Defiant and Speed-boosting Embody Aspect after Terastallization. Combined with access to Follow Me and natural immunity to Spore, Ogerpon is capable of being a constant threat while still providing good supportive value.

  • Ogerpon is almost exclusively used on teams built around Dondozo. With its ability Defiant, Ogerpon can be used to punish Incineroar and Gouging Fire, disincentivizing them from weakening both Dondozo and Chien-Pao and even picking up a clean OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower. Once Terastallized, It can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes, which are difficult for Dondozo and Chien-pao or Dragonite to handle.

  • Ogerpon struggles against Pokemon that resist Grass STAB as Tornadus and Raging Bolt as well as foes that outspeed it, either forcing Ogerpon to Terastallize or be unable to attack before fainting, such as Chien-Pao, which outspeeds and can survive one hit thanks to it usually holding a Focus Sash. Ogerpon's Grass typing means it's weak to common threats such as Chien-Pao and Gouging Fire, and its middling bulk makes it unable to take more than two attacks most of the time.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Superpower is used as coverage to hit Steel- and the plethora of Dark-types that resist Ivy Cudgel, such as Kingambit or Chi-yu. Follow Me can be used to redirect attention from the frailer Chien-Pao and Glimmora, making both exponentially harder to deal with, especially so considering Ogerpon resists Urshifu-R Surging Strike's, one of the best counters to Chien-Pao and Glimmora

  • Covert Cloak is used to prevent a flinch from Fake Out, allowing Ogerpon to pressure Incineroar and its partner turn one. Additionally, blocking certain secondary effects such as Icy Wind's Speed drops from opposing Flutter Manes is useful.

  • The Attack investment is necessary to guarantee an OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower, on Flutter Mane once Ogerpon Terastallizes, and to have the highest chance of an OHKO on Urshifu-R. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T after Terastallization. The rest of the EVs are used to round out Ogerpon's bulk.

Offensive Support.description:
Ogerpon-W is a bulky attacker with the ability to redirect with Follow Me. It has an excellent Kyogre matchup and can take on Calyrex-S well after Terastallizing, being able to not only take their hits effectively but also threaten them for 2HKOs with Horn Leech and Ivy Cudgel, respectively. The HP and Special Defense investment allow Ogerpon-W to survive two Spell Tag Astral Barrages from Calyrex-S once Terastallized. The Attack investment allows Ogerpon-W to OHKO Landorus-I with Tera Water even after Intimidate, and the Speed investment lets it outspeed Landorus-I.

Ogerpon-W's supportive toolkit and strong offensive pressure are appreciated on a variety of teams. Calyrex-I teams frequently use it to beat opposing Kyogre and have an attacker that can function outside of Trick Room. Calyrex-S also makes for a great pairing, with Ogerpon-W's redirection allowing Calyrex-S to set up while Ogerpon-W threatens Incineroar and Chi-Yu. Incineroar provides Intimidate, which in combination with Embody Aspect makes Ogerpon-W hard to remove. Ogerpon-W further accentuates this pairing by redirecting attacks that threaten Incineroar such as Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Earth Power from Landorus-I. Common threats such as Rillaboom and Raging Bolt wall Ogerpon-W and return with strong damage, and Incineroar makes Ogerpon-W less threatening. However, Ogerpon-W can still provide value in these matchups by supporting partners like Calyrex-I, which can deal with the former two. Teams without Calyrex-I still can use Ogerpon-W to protect powerful threats such as Calyrex-S, which can eventually overwhelm the opposition.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Horn Leech is the Grass-type move of choice, as Ogerpon-W appreciates the extra longevity, which becomes especially notable when combined with the Special Defense boost provided by Terastallizing.

  • The EV spread outspeeds Modest Landorus, OHKOes bulky Flutter Mane after Tera, and survives Rillaboom's terrain-boosted Wood Hammer.

Offensive.description:
Ogerpon-H functions as an offensive Pokemon that can support its team in a pinch with Follow Me. Wood Hammer and Grassy Glide threaten Water-types such as Urshifu-R and Pelipper, which would otherwise resist Ivy Cudgel. Ogerpon-H has a good matchup into Grass-types such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom, since it can threaten both of them with Ivy Cudgel and redirect Spore and Grass-type STAB moves from the two. Wood Hammer is used to maximize damage output, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane, and Grassy Glide is used for priority in Grassy Terrain. Follow Me is used to allow its partner to set up, redirect attacks in a pinch, and redirect Spore from Amoonguss

Ogerpon-H appreciates partners that can help enable its damage output. Some of the best partners for Ogerpon-H are Koraidon, Groudon, and Rillaboom. Both Koraidon and Groudon set up sun, allowing Ogerpon-H to deal massive damage with sun-boosted Ivy Cudgel. Rillaboom offers Fake Out support for Ogerpon-H, giving it free turns to set up Swords Dance and sweep. Rillaboom also sets up Grassy Terrain when it switches in, enabling priority Grassy Glide. Incineroar is Ogerpon-H's main check, as Incineroar is able to switch into all of Ogerpon-H's attacks, while also reducing its damage output with Intimidate. Dragon-types such as Koraidon and Raging Bolt are also nuisances to Ogerpon-H, since they wall it and can safely attack it or set up with Swords Dance and Calm Mind, respectively.

Offensive Redirector.description:
Ogerpon-C is an offensive redirector, keeping allies such as Miraidon and Calyrex-I safe while eliminating common foes like Ogerpon-H, Tornadus, and Chi-Yu. Ogerpon-C has an excellent matchup into Amoonguss, as it can redirect Spore. Follow Me allows Ogerpon-C to keep its partner safe. Power Whip is used to do big damage to Pokemon like Groudon and Urshifu-R while keeping Sturdy intact. Alternatively, Horn Leech can be used to sacrifice power for recovery, allowing Ogerpon-C to reactivate Sturdy, while Wood Hammer is used for a burst of damage, but it breaks Sturdy.

Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Koraidon can wall Ogerpon-C, with the former being able to set up Iron Defense. Ogerpon-C is walled by Steel-types like Kingambit and Zacian-C, both of which can safely set up Swords Dance in front of it. Additionally, Gholdengo also walls Ogerpon-C and can set up with Nasty Plot. Due to its great ability to redirect attacks, Ogerpon-C is commonly seen on hyper offense Tailwind or Trick Room teams supporting Restricted Pokemon like Miraidon and Calyrex-I. Ogerpon-C also adds a fast mode on Trick Room teams and has great damage output while removing problematic foes like Incineroar. Some good partners for Ogerpon-C, aside from Calyrex-I and Miraidon, are Whimsicott, Tornadus, and Farigiraf. Whimsicott or Tornadus can set Tailwind for Ogerpon-C to outspeed faster Pokemon like Flutter Mane, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Chi-Yu, threatening to OHKO them. Finally, Farigiraf blocks Fake Out, letting Ogerpon-C deal a lot damage; Ogerpon-C can also help Farigiraf set Trick Room thanks to Follow Me support.

Redirection Support.description:
• Ivy Cudgel synergizes well with Ogerpon-C's Grass-type moves, hitting Fire- and Flying-types like Tornadus, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu.

  • Horn Leech provides Ogerpon-C with recovery, while Power Whip hits targets harder, threatening an OHKO on Urshifu-R.

  • Follow Me lets it redirect moves away from its teammates like Sucker Punch and Spore from Chien-Pao and Amoonguss, respectively.

  • Tera Rock bolsters Ivy Cudgel's damage, letting it guarantee an OHKO on Entei, and the Defense boost thanks to Embody Aspect can let it almost always survive Close Combat from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Archaludon.overview:
• Archaludon can utilize its above-average bulk, solid Special Attack stat, and great Ability in Stamina to check and OHKO threats such as Urshifu-R, Incineroar, and Raging Bolt.

  • Archaludon's access to Stamina and Body Press combined with its resistances and great physical bulk make it an amazing check to Pokemon such as Rillaboom and the Ogerpon formes and also allow it to act as a wincon.

  • Archaludon appreciates teammates like Amoonguss and Sinistcha that provide it with recovery through Pollen Puff and Hospitality, as well as Rage Powder for redirection. Rillaboom provides Fake Out support, as well as passive healing through Grassy Terrain and priority with Grassy Glide that discourages the opponent from leading with Urshifu-R. Dual screens from Grimmsnarl and damage reduction from Incineroar's Intimidate or Snarl are also useful for keeping Archaludon alive to stack Stamina or Electro Shot stat increases.

  • Archaludon fits well on rain teams thanks to its Grass and Electric resistances. It appreciates teammates such as Pelipper that can check opposing Ground- and Fighting-types like Landorus and both Urshifu formes; Pelipper's rain support also allows Electro Shot to charge in one turn, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Tornadus. Archaludon also functions well on Trick Room teams due to many of its checks being faster than it, such as both Urshifu formes, Landorus, and Chien-Pao running Sacred Sword. Farigiraf pairs notably well with Archaludon on Trick Room teams due to the protection from priority it provides and its access to Psychic Noise, which disables Iron Hands's Drain Punch.

Rain Sweeper.description:
• Archaludon's Defense EVs allow it to survive Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's and Urshifu-S's Close Combat, meaning it can take a hit, boost itself with Electro Shot, and OHKO Urshifu-R on the same turn, provided rain is currently active. The Special Defense investment prevents it from being 2HKOed by Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Archaludon does not particularly require Special Attack investment thanks to Electro Shot boosting this stat, but 36 Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature give Archaludon an extra point in Special Attack because of how stat calculation works.

  • 28 Speed EVs are to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Urshifu-S and Landorus-T when Archaludon is under Tailwind.

  • Draco Meteor and Electro Shot OHKO Pokemon such as Raging Bolt, Urshifu-R, and Tornadus. Flash Cannon OHKOes Flutter Mane after one Electro Shot boost, and Body Press is good to threaten an OHKO on Chien-Pao, and significant damage on Incineroar, especially after a Stamina boost.

  • Tera Grass gives Archaludon a resistance to Ground-type moves such as Landorus's Sandsear Storm and Earth Power, and immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Meanwhile, Tera Fairy gives it a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity to beat Urshifu and opposing Dragon-types respectively.

Gouging Fire.overview:
• Gouging Fire is a solid offensive support Pokemon with a good defensive typing. Breaking Swipe and Burning Bulwark give it a great matchup against physical attackers such as Rillaboom and Chien-Pao.

  • Kingambit is one of the most prominent partners for Gouging Fire, because it prevents Incineroar from crippling Gouging Fire with Intimidate. Ogerpon-W fits well with Gouging Fire as well, as with Follow Me it can protect Gouging Fire from Ground- and Water-type moves, both of which Ogerpon-W resists.

  • The Urshifu formes counter Gouging Fire, since they ignore Burning Bulwark and Breaking Swipe. Incineroar is also a good counter to Gouging Fire, cycling Intimidate and Parting Shot repeatedly until Gouging Fire is a sitting duck. Gouging Fire also struggles against special attackers like Flutter Mane and Landorus, which can hit it for big damage, the latter threatening it for an OHKO.

Offensive Support.description:
• Heat Crash is a reliable way of dealing damage, and because Gouging Fire is so heavy, it will almost always do good damage against most of the metagame. Howl can be used to take advantage of passive playstyles and partially negate Intimidate, and with a Speed Booster Energy, it can support the Kingambit and Ogerpon-W in return.

  • 252 HP and 20 Defense EVs allow you to always live two Wicked Blows from Adamant Urshifu-S, and 164 Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allow you to and outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Landorus-T and Chien-Pao once the Booster Energy has been consumed.

  • Tera Grass is a good defensive Tera type for Gouging Fire, as it lets Gouging Fire resist Ground-type moves like Landorus's Earth Power and makes it immune to Spore, which is crucial since Burning Bulwark doesn't Protect Gouging Fire from status moves. Tera Fairy is also a good option as well, as it lets Gouging Fire resist both of Urshifu-S's STAB moves and take neutral damage from the majority of the metagame.

Bulky Attacker.description:
Raging Bolt is an incredibly bulky special attacker that can stay on the field and survive hits from Restricted Pokemon, and threaten them back with its huge Special Attack stat and weaken their team with stat reducing moves. It matches up incredibly well into Urshifu-R, keeping it in check with Thunderclap, Koraidon, since it commonly doesn't run Dragon-type moves, common Fire / Water / Grass cores, which usually have Incineroar, Rillaboom, and Urshifu-R or Ogerpon-W, and multiple strong special attackers with Snarl, such as Kyogre, Calyrex-S, and Terapagos. Electroweb gives Raging Bolt a solid speed control option while still dealing relevant damage. Thunderbolt is a consistent and strong STAB option, and Volt Switch gives it a strong way to reposition itself. Assault Vest allows it to survive hits more easily from strong special attackers such as Calyrex-S, Terapagos, Kyogre, Flutter Mane, and opposing Raging Bolt while punishing them with a Snarl, Electroweb, or stronger attacking move. The EV spread allows it to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao, and outspeed -1 Gholdengo and Adamant Urshifu. Tera Electric significantly increases the damage it does at the cost of remaining vulnerable to strong Ground-type attackers such as Landorus and Groudon, while Tera Fairy allows it to gain an immunity to threatening Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Miraidon and opposing Raging Bolt while still having a very strong defensive typing into the current metagame.

Raging Bolt synergizes well with multiple Pokemon and can work on many team structures, but some notable partners are Incineroar, since it can reduce the threat from physical moves that Raging Bolt cannot weaken, Koraidon, since it activates Raging Bolt's ability Protosynthesis by setting up sun, and Urshifu-R, which checks multiple strong threats to Raging Bolt like Calyrex-I, Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Landorus. Another Pokemon that checks Raging Bolt is Amoonguss, since Raging Bolt can't stop a Spore from going off and Raging Bolt's attacks can be redirected by Rage Powder without many issues. It is also vulnerable to Fake Out, since Raging Bolt is unable to use Protect to block it because of its Assault Vest, and variants without Draco Meteor can't threaten Incineroar for high damage, allowing it to use Parting Shot and pivot out relatively safely.

Three Attacks.description:
Raging Bolt's high Special Attack, bolstered by Booster Energy increasing its damage output significantly, makes it an immediate force to be reckoned with. It has positive matchups against Kyogre and Urshifu-R, resisting their STAB attacks and threatening huge damage or an OHKO on them, respectively, with its STAB moves. Raging Bolt also matches up well against Koraidon, threatening an OHKO with Draco Meteor or Dragon Pulse. Draco Meteor allows Raging Bolt to pick up valuable KOs with a risky drawback, while Dragon Pulse lets it deal consistent damage. The given EV spread allows Raging Bolt to survive Precipice Blades from Groudon and Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao, while the Special Attack investment nets OHKOs on Landorus and Ursaluna-B with Draco Meteor. Tera Electric provides a powerful damage boost, allowing Raging Bolt to pick up OHKOs on Kyogre and Tera Ghost Urshifu-R and a 2HKO on Sitrus Berry Incineroar with Thunderbolt, which it usually would not be able to do. Tera Fairy provides a Dragon immunity against Dragon-types that threaten Raging Bolt such as Miraidon on top of removing all of its original weaknesses and providing a good defensive typing.

Raging Bolt struggles against strong Ground-types such as Landorus, Ursaluna-B, and Groudon, all of which deal significant damage to it, while Calyrex-I is very difficult for Raging Bolt to remove due to its high bulk and potential to OHKO it in return. This makes Calyrex-I and Pelipper exceptional partners, as they threaten OHKOs on Landorus, Ursaluna-B, and Groudon. Additionally, Calyrex-I threatens Landorus and Groudon after they use Tera with High Horsepower, while Pelipper provides Wide Guard support, making it extremely difficult for opposing Calyrex-I to remove. Ogerpon-W provides valuable redirection while comfortably surviving attacks from the aforementioned Ground-types, as well as threatening KOs on them with Ivy Cudgel. Farigiraf prevents Raging Bolt from using Thunderclap and often uses Tera Fairy, granting it immunity to Draco Meteor and Dragon Pulse, while Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane also threaten to deal siginificant damage on Raging Bolt. As a result, Zamazenta-C is a great partner, 2HKOing Farigiraf before and after using Tera with Body Press and either Heavy Slam or Behemoth Bash, respectively, as well as easily OHKOing Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane. Incineroar is also an exceptional partner, as it is capable of reducing Calyrex-I's damage through Will-O-Wisp, being difficult for Farigiraf to KO, and dealing significant damage to Chien-Pao with Flare Blitz.

Calm Mind.description:
Raging Bolt's good natural bulk allows it to function well as a bulky setup sweeper. It has good matchups against Kyogre and Urshifu-R due to STAB Thunderclap. Dragon Pulse is commonly used to break Pokemon that resist Thunderclap, like opposing Raging Bolt and Miraidon. Dragon Pulse may also aid against Pokemon with redirection like Ogerpon-W or Armor Tail Farigiraf that blocks Thunderclap. Leftovers is the preferred item on Calm Mind Raging Bolt due to the increased longevity, especially when paired with Grassy Terrain support from Rillaboom. Alternatively, Raging Bolt can use Booster Energy for an immediate power boost, threatening an OHKO on Miraidon and a 2HKO on Calyrex-S. 244 HP and 52 Defense EVs allow Raging Bolt to survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner. The HP and Special Defense EVs allow +1 Special Defense Terastallized Raging Bolt to survive two attacks from both Modest Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Landorus's Earth Power. 92 Speed EVs allow Raging Bolt to outspeed 4 Speed Rillaboom. Tera Fairy is the Tera type of choice because it provides Raging Bolt an even matchup into most of the format.

Good partners for Calm Mind Raging Bolt include Rillaboom because it can provide Grassy Terrain and create free turns with Fake Out, allowing Raging Bolt to set up more safely. Similarly, Incineroar is often paired with Raging Bolt, since it can offer damage reduction and Fake Out support. Redirection, such as Ogerpon-W's Follow Me, is greatly appreciated by Raging Bolt. Groudon and Koraidon are also good partners for Raging Bolt, since they can activate its Protosynthesis ability and check Pokemon like Amoonguss and Zacian-C, which are common checks for Raging Bolt. Amoonguss threatens Raging Bolt's Thunderclap via Rage Powder redirection and Spore. Zacian-C, Groudon, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Calyrex-I, and Landorus can threaten Raging Bolt before and after it Terastallizes.

Assault Vest.description:
• Electroweb is sometimes run over Thunderbolt for speed control. Volt Switch allows for Raging Bolt to become a bulky pivot and pairs well with Draco Meteor, allowing it to switch out after the Special Attack drop. Snarl weakens opposing special attackers, enabling it to sit on the field for longer and deal damage. Tera Blast gives Raging Bolt a strong option into bulky Dark-types and Fighting-types like Ting-Lu and Iron Hands.

  • Assault Vest allows Raging Bolt to fully take advantage of its amazing bulk, letting it sit on the field and tank hit after hit all while dealing respectable damage and disrupting the foe with moves like Snarl and Electroweb.

  • The defensive investment allows Raging Bolt to always survive Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Glimmora and Modest Chi-Yu after an Electroweb. The rest of the EVs were put into offensive investment.

  • Tera Fairy is just an incredibly strong neutral Tera type, especially for a Pokemon with as much bulk as Raging Bolt has, and provides a resistance to Urshifu-S's STAB moves.

3 Attacks.description:
• Thunderbolt provides good consistent damage, especially with Tera Electric, while Thunderclap helps make up for Raging Bolt's middling Speed. Draco Meteor is a more powerful option, being able to OHKO Pokmon like Landorus when used with Booster Energy. However, it can be forced to switch out after a Special Attack drop and lose the boost.

  • Booster Energy is a strong option, as boosting Raging Bolt's already huge base Special Attack even further turns it into an absolute nuke. Safety Goggles prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Thunderclaps away from Urshifu-R.

  • The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao while under Tailwind, allowing it to hit them with its stronger options like Thunderbolt and Draco Meteor.

  • Tera Grass is a good option to not only resist Ground-type moves from Landorus but also ignore Amoonguss's Spore and redirection with Rage Powder without running Safety Goggles. Tera Electric will often be a consistent option for just raw damage output.

Iron Crown.overview:
• Iron Crown is an excellent choice for offensive teams looking to take advantage of the powerful move Expanding Force thanks to its well-rounded stats and access to Booster Energy. It performs best against frailer offensive teams consisting of Pokemon that do not resist Expanding Force, such as Tornadus, Landorus, and Urshifu-R.

  • Although it can be used as a sweeper early-game to soften opposing teams, it is usually better to save Iron Crown for the late-game when its checks have been sufficiently weakened for it to sweep.

  • Indeedee-F is by far Iron Crown's best teammate, offering role compression as a Psychic Terrain setter and redirector. Access to Helping Hand also further amplifies its partner's ridiculous damage output.

  • Iron Crown's best counters are Dark- and Steel-types, namely Incineroar, Kingambit, Archaludon, and Gholdengo, all of which resist both of Iron Crown's STAB moves.

  • Therefore, Iron Crown appreciates Pokemon that can help remove these threats consistently, such as Landorus, Entei, and Urshifu-R. In return, Iron Crown can pressure opposing Urshifu-R and Amoonguss.

  • Rillaboom is another noteworthy check, as it is able to safely pivot in and override Psychic Terrain, weakening Expanding Force significantly. Other Pokemon with access to Ice Spinner like Chien-Pao and Dragonite can also be used to remove Psychic Terrain.

  • Faster Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane serve as good checks as well, but they have to watch out for Follow Me from Indeedee-F as they are vulnerable to Tachyon Cutter.

Booster Energy.description:
• Expanding Force is Iron Crown's go-to STAB move, allowing it to devastate foes under Psychic Terrain.

  • Tachyon Cutter helps secure the OHKO on Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Whimsicott, which commonly hold Focus Sash.

  • Tera Water is a naturally good defensive typing that, when coupled with Tera Blast, gives Iron Crown an out against the aforementioned Dark- and Steel-type Pokemon, which otherwise counter it. Focus Blast can be used over Tera Blast to secure the OHKO on Kingambit, but is rather inconsistent and is unable to hit Gholdengo.

  • An alternative spread of 76 HP / 4 Def / 172 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe allows Iron Crown to outspeed Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao thanks to Speed Booster Energy.

  • This set can also be run with a Modest nature to maximize Iron Crown's damage output, at the risk of underspeeding opposing Pokemon in the same Speed tier such as Modest Landorus and both Urshifu formes.

Choice Specs.description:
Terapagos can be used as a hyper offensive threat with its high Special Attack and powerful spread move, Tera Starstorm. Choice Specs immediately boosts the damage output from Tera Starstorm, allowing Terapagos to pick up early-game KOs, which the more common Calm Mind set cannot. Its natural bulk in addition to Tera Shell allows it to withstand powerful attacks that other hyper offensive threats may not be able to. Terapagos has a very good matchup into the oppressive Calyrex-S with an immunity to Astral Barrage. Teraform Zero disrupts strategies revolving around Miraidon, Groudon and Kyogre's Terrain- and weather-setting abilities. Tera Starstorm is the attack Terapagos will want to use most of the time, but Earth Power and Dark Pulse provide coverage for Steel- and Ghost-types that its partners may not be able to comfortably defeat, like Zamazenta-C and Calyrex-S. Hyper Beam allows Terapagos to pick up KOs around Wide Guard users while Terastallized. Sleep Talk allows Terapagos to continue dealing significant damage even when put to sleep from moves such as Amoonguss's Spore.

With a middling Speed stat, Terapagos greatly benefits from Tailwind support, which allows it to outspeed and significantly damage its foes more effectively. Tornadus is the best priority Tailwind setter in the format, so it is naturally a great partner for Choice Specs Terapagos. It also deals super effective damage to Fighting-types that threaten Terapagos like the Urshifu formes. Tornadus can utilize priority Taunt to shut down Wide Guard users, most Trick Room setters, and Spore from opposing Amoonguss. Zamazenta-C is very difficult for Terapagos to defeat because of its natural typing and Wide Guard, so it relies on a partner Chi-Yu to defeat it or cripple its offense with Will-O-Wisp. Chi-Yu easily defeats Steel- and Ghost-types that Terapagos struggles against and provides Beads of Ruin support. Amoonguss provides great redirection support with Rage Powder in the face of threats such as Mienshao and both Urshifu formes, and it can shut down threats with Spore. Pollen Puff benefits Terapagos with healing, reactivating Tera Shell. Flutter Mane can check Koraidon with its natural typing as well as provide Icy Wind and Taunt support. Lunala is tough to break with its high natural bulk and Shadow Shield alongside Wide Guard, but a partner Incineroar can weaken its Special Attack and KO it with Snarl and Knock Off. Ting-Lu's great special bulk thanks to Assault Vest and Vessel of Ruin is very difficult for Terapagos to break through, and it can reduce Terapagos's Special Attack further with Snarl. This makes Urshifu-R a great partner, forcing Ting-Lu to Terastallize to remove its weakness to Urshifu-R's STAB moves while gaining a weakness to Terapagos. Koraidon can survive Tera Starstorm and threaten an OHKO on Terastallized Terapagos in return. A partner Flutter Mane forces Koraidon to Terastallize, making it weak to Terapagos. Pelipper is tough for Terapagos to break due to its access to Wide Guard and immunity to Earth Power, so it appreciates partners such as Raging Bolt to threaten Pelipper.

Calm Mind.description:
Terapagos is a bulky setup sweeper, with Tera Shell boosting its already great longevity with its high natural bulk. In addition to this, Tera Starstorm becomes a powerful unresisted spread move when Terapagos Terastallizes. Earth Power is ran to allow Terapagos to deal significant damage to Steel-types and Wide Guard users it otherwise would struggle to defeat, notably Zamazenta-C. Leftovers benefits Terapagos's longevity when it does not have a partner to heal it, allowing Tera Shell to be reactivated. Covert Cloak is also a great item, as it prevents Terapagos's Special Attack from being lowered by opposing Snarl and provides the bonus of making it immune to flinch from Fake Out. Clear Amulet is used similarly to Covert Cloak but also prevents Parting Shot lowering Terapagos's Special Attack. Terapagos matches up very well against Calyrex-S, as it is immune to Astral Barrage, and damage from Draining Kiss and Expanding Force can be mitigated by its massive bulk bolstered by Tera Shell, Special Defense boosts from Calm Mind, and partners such as Amoonguss with Rage Powder and Pollen Puff. Teraform Zero disrupts strategies revolving around Miraidon, Groudon and Kyogre's terrain and weather setting abilities. The given EV spread allows Terapagos to survive Collision Course from Koraidon on the physically defensive side and Electro Drift from Choice Specs Miraidon on the specially defensive side with Tera Shell active or while Terastallized. With the bulk the spread provides, Electro Drift becomes a guaranteed 3HKO with Leftovers recovery after Electric Terrain is removed. The Special Attack investment maximizes the value of Terapagos's Calm Mind boosts, the Speed investment lets it outpace 4 Speed investment Rillaboom, and the HP EVs maximize the recovery gained from Leftovers.

Rillaboom is a great partner for Terapagos, providing Grassy Terrain recovery and Fake Out to allow it to gain Calm Mind boosts. Incineroar is another great partner, as it can assist Terapagos in defeating Steel- and Ghost-types with Flare Blitz and Knock Off, as well as providing defensive utility through Intimidate, Parting Shot, and Will-O-Wisp on top of Fake Out. Amoonguss supports Terapagos very well, providing HP recovery with Pollen Puff. Its Rage Powder and Spore also allow Terapagos to safely use Calm Mind. Terapagos struggles to defeat Calyrex-I-centred teams, as it is very reliant on a partner Incineroar to reduce the physical damage it takes and deal super effective damage to Calyrex-I. Zamazenta-C can use Wide Guard, preventing Terapagos from dealing damage with Tera Starstorm while Terastallized, and Terapagos is very reliant on Earth Power as well as partners like Incineroar to deal super effective damage to it. As a result, Gholdengo pairs well with Terapagos, since it reliably checks both Calyrex-I and Zamazenta-C with its natural typing. Koraidon can be troublesome, as it can outdamage Terapagos's teammates' recovery while it is setting up with Calm Mind. Taunt Flutter Mane sets cause huge problems for Terapagos, since it cannot damage Flutter Mane significantly if Flutter Mane has not Terastallized, and Terapagos deals little damage without Calm Mind boosts.
